Text

﻿Ford [Madox Ford]1-madox ford Last Post

Dedicatory Letter

To [Isabel Paterson Madame et cher Confrere]188-isabel paterson madame et cher confrere ,

[I]0-i have for some years now had to consider [you]488-you as being [[my]0-i fairy godmother in [the United States]490-the united states]489-my fairy godmother in the united states — though how [one]491-one can have a godmother junior to [oneself]491-one [I]0-i have yet to figure out . Perhaps [godmothers of the kind that can turn pumpkins into glass coaches can achieve miracles in seniority]492-godmothers of the kind that can turn pumpkins into glass coaches can achieve miracles in seniority . Or , when [I]0-i come to think of it , [I]0-i seem to remember that , for [a whole tribe of Incas]493-a whole tribe of incas converted who knows how and simultaneously , in the days of [the Conquistadores]494-the conquistadores , [an Infanta of]495-an infanta of [Spain]2-spain went to the font , [she]495-an infanta of being , whatever [her]495-an infanta of age , of necessity junior to [the elders at least of [the tribe]497-the tribe]496-the elders at least of the tribe . That , however , is all a trifle - except for [my]0-i gratitude!—compared with [your]488-you present responsibility . For , but for [you]488-you , this book would only nebularly have existed — in space , in [my]0-i brain , where [you]488-you will , so it be not on paper and between boards . Save , that is to say , for [your]488-you stem , contemptuous and almost virulent insistence on knowing “ what became of [Tietjens]189-tietjens ” [I]0-i never should have conducted this chronicle to the stage it has now reached . [The soldier]498-the soldier , tired of war ’s alarms , it has always seemed to [me]0-i , might be allowed to rest beneath [bowery vines]499-bowery vines . But [you]488-you would not have it so . [You]488-you — and for once [you]488-you align [yourself]488-you with [the Great Public]500-the great public — demand an ending : if possible a happy ending . Alas , [I]0-i can not provide [you]488-you with the end of [Tietjens]189-tietjens for a reason upon which [I]0-i will later dwell — but [I]0-i here provide [you]488-you with a slice of one of [Christopher]190-christopher ’s later days so that [you]488-you may know how more or less [he]190-christopher at present stands . For in [this world of [ours]502-we]501-this world of ours though lives may end Affairs do not . Even though [Valentine]191-valentine and [Tietjens]189-tietjens were dead the Affair that [they]503-they set going would go rolling on down the generations — [Mark junior]192-mark and [Mrs. Lowther]193-mrs. lowther , [the unborn child]504-the unborn child and [the rest]505-the rest will go on beneath the nut - boughs or over [the seas]506-the seas — or in the best [Clubs]3-clubs . It is not [your]488-you day nor [mine]0-i that shall see the end of [them]503-they . And think : How many people have [we]502-we not known intimately and seen daily for years ! Then [they]503-they move into [another township]507-another township , and , [bad correspondents]508-bad correspondents as [we]502-we all are and sit - at - [homes]509-homes as [Fate]194-fate makes [most of [us]502-we]510-most of us , [they]503-they drop out of [our]502-we sights . [They]503-they may — [those friends of [yours]488-you]511-those friends of yours — go and settle in [Paris]4-paris . [You]488-you may see [them]503-they for fortnights at decennial intervals , or [you]488-you may not . So [I]0-i would have preferred to let it be with [Tietjens]189-tietjens , but [you]488-you would not have it . [I]0-i have always jeered at [authors who sentimentalised over [their]512-authors who sentimentalised over their characters characters]512-authors who sentimentalised over their characters , and after finishing a book exclaim like , say , [Thackeray]195-thackeray : “ Roll up the curtains ; put the puppets in [their]512-authors who sentimentalised over their characters boxes ; quench the tallow footlights ” . . . something like that . But [I]0-i am bound to say that in certain moods in [Avignon]5-avignon this year it would less have surprised [me]0-i to go up to [the upper chamber of [the mill where [I]0-i wrote and there to find [that friend of mine]515-that friend of mine]514-the mill where i wrote and there to find that friend of mine than to find [you]488-you]513-the upper chamber of the mill where i wrote and there to find that friend of mine than to find you . For [you]488-you are to remember that for [me]0-i [Tietjens]189-tietjens is the recreation of [a friend [I]0-i had]516-a friend i had — a friend so vivid to [me]0-i that though [he]516-a friend i had died many years ago [I]0-i can not feel that [he]516-a friend i had is yet dead . In the dedicatory letter of an earlier instalment of this series of books [I]0-i said that in these volumes [I]0-i was trying to project how [this world]517-this world would have appeared to [that friend]518-that friend today and how , in it , [he]518-that friend would have acted — or [you]488-you , [I]0-i believe , would say reacted . And that is the exact truth of the matter . Do [you]488-you not find — [you]488-you [yourself]488-you , too — that , however it may be with the mass of [humanity]519-humanity , in the case of [certain dead people [you]488-you can not feel that [they]520-certain dead people you can not feel that they are indeed gone from this world are indeed gone from [this world]517-this world]520-certain dead people you can not feel that they are indeed gone from this world ? [You]488-you can only know it , [you]488-you can only believe it . That is , at any rate , the case with [me]0-i — and in [my]0-i case [the world]522-the world daily becomes more and [more peopled with such revenants]523-more peopled with such revenants and less and less with [those who still walk [this earth]525-this earth]524-those who still walk this earth . It is only yesterday that [I]0-i read of the death of [another human being who will for the rest of time]526-another human being who will for the rest of time have for [me]0-i that effect . [That person]527-that person died thousands of miles away , and yesterday it would have astonished [me]0-i if [she]527-that person had walked into [[my]0-i room here in [New York]6-new york]528-my room here in new york . To - day it would no longer . It would have the aspect of the simplest thing in [the world]522-the world . So then , for [me]0-i , it is with [Tietjens]189-tietjens . With [his]189-tietjens prototype [I]0-i set out on several enterprises — one of them being a considerable periodical publication of [a Tory kind]530-a tory kind — and for many years [I]0-i was accustomed as it were to “ set ” [my]0-i mind by [his]189-tietjens comments on public or other affairs . [He]189-tietjens was , as [I]0-i have elsewhere said , [the English Tory]531-the english tory — [the last English Tory]532-the last english tory , omniscient , slightly contemptuous — and sentimental in [his]189-tietjens human contacts . And for many years before [I]0-i contemplated the writing of these books — before the War even — [I]0-i was accustomed to ask [myself]0-i not merely what [he]189-tietjens would have said of certain public or private affairs , but how [he]189-tietjens would have acted in certain positions . And [I]0-i do so still . [I]0-i have only to say to [my]0-i mind , as [the child on the knees of an adult]533-the child on the knees of an adult says to [its]533-the child on the knees of an adult senior : “ Tell [us]534-us [a fairy]535-a fairy tale!”—I have only to say : “ Tell [us]534-us what [he]189-tietjens would here have done ! ” and at once [he]189-tietjens is there . So , [you]536-you see , [I]0-i can not tell [you]536-you the end of [Tietjens]189-tietjens , for [he]189-tietjens will end only when [I]0-i am beyond pens and paper . For [me]0-i at this moment [he]189-tietjens is , oddly enough , in [Avignon]5-avignon , rather disappointed in the quality of the Louis Seize furniture that [he]189-tietjens has found [there]537-there , and seated in front of [the Taverne Riche]7-the taverne riche under the planes [he]189-tietjens is finding [his]189-tietjens Harris tweeds oppressive . Perhaps [he]189-tietjens is even mopping the whitish brow under [his]189-tietjens silver - streaked hair . And [I]0-i have a strong itch to write to [him]189-tietjens that if [he]189-tietjens wants to find [Louis Treize]8-louis treize stuff of the most admirable — perfectly fabulous armoires and chests — for almost nothing , [he]189-tietjens should go westward into [the Limousin]9-the limousin to . . . But nothing shall make [me]0-i here write that name . . . . And so [he]189-tietjens will go jogging along with ups and downs and plenty of worries and some satisfaction , [the Tory Englishman]196-the tory englishman , running [his]189-tietjens head perhaps against fewer walls , perhaps against more , until [I]0-i [myself]0-i cease from those pursuits . . . . Perhaps [he]189-tietjens will go on even longer , if [you]538-you , as [Marraine]197-marraine , succeed in conferring upon these works that longevity . . . . But out and alas , now [you]538-you can never write about [me]0-i again : for it would , would n’t it ? look too much like : [You]538-you scratch [my]0-i back and [I]0-i ’ll scratch [yours]538-you ! So do n’t write about [Tietjens]189-tietjens : write [your]538-you own projections of the lives around [you]538-you in terms of [your]538-you delicate and fierce art . Then [you]538-you will find [me]0-i still more [Your]539-your grateful and obedient F. M. F. [New York]6-new york , October 11th , 1927 . Part one

Chapter 1

[HE]189-tietjens lay staring at the withy binders of [his]189-tietjens thatch ; the grass was infinitely green ; [his]189-tietjens view embraced [four counties]540-four counties ; the roof was supported by six small oak sapling - trunks , roughly trimmed and brushed from above by apple boughs . French crab - apple ! [The hut]541-the hut had no sides . The Italian proverb says : [He]189-tietjens who allows the boughs of trees to spread above [his]189-tietjens roof , invites [the doctor]542-the doctor daily . Words to that effect . [He]189-tietjens would have grinned , but that might have been seen . For [a man who never moved]543-a man who never moved , [his]543-a man who never moved face was singularly walnut - coloured ; [his]543-a man who never moved head , indenting the skim - milk white of the pillows should have been a gipsy ’s , the dark , silvered hair cut extremely close , the whole face very carefully shaven and completely immobile . The eyes moved , however , with unusual , vivacity , all the life of [the man]544-the man being concentrated in them and [their]545-their lids . Down the path that had been cut in swathes from the knee - high grass , and came from [the stable]546-the stable to [the hut]541-the hut , [a heavy elderly peasant]548-a heavy elderly peasant rolled in [his]548-a heavy elderly peasant gait . [His]548-a heavy elderly peasant over - long , hairy arms swung as if [he]548-a heavy elderly peasant needed an axe or a log or a full sack to make [him]548-a heavy elderly peasant [a complete man]549-a complete man . [He]548-a heavy elderly peasant was broad - beamed , in cord breeches , very tight in the buttock ; [he]548-a heavy elderly peasant were black leggings , an unbuttoned blue waistcoat , a striped flannel shirt , open at the perspiring neck , and a square , high hat of black felt . [He]548-a heavy elderly peasant said : “ Want to be shifted ? ” [The man in the bed]550-the man in the bed closed [his]550-the man in the bed eyelids slowly . “ Ave a droper cider ? ” [The other again similarly]551-the other again similarly closed [his]550-the man in the bed eyes . [The standing man]552-the standing man supported [himself]552-the standing man with an immense hand , gorilla - like , by one of the oaken posts . “ Best droper cider ever [I]0-i tasted , ” [he]0-i said . “ Is [Lordship]198-gunning give [me]0-i . Is [Lordship]198-gunning sester [me]0-i : ‘ Gunning , ’ e ses , . . . ‘ the day [the vixen]553-the vixen got into [[keeper]554-keeper ’s coop enclosure]555-keeper ’s coop enclosure . . . ’ ” [He]548-a heavy elderly peasant began and slowly completed a very long story , going to prove that [English noble landlords]556-english noble landlords preferred foxes to pheasants . Or should ! [English landowners of the right sort]557-english landowners of the right sort . Is [Lordship]198-gunning would no more ave that vixen killed or so much as flurried , [she]553-the vixen being gravid like than . . . . Dreadful work a gravid vixen can do among encoops with pheasant poults . . . . Have to eat fer six or seven , [she]553-the vixen have ! All a - growing . . . . So is [Lordship sester Gunning]198-gunning . . . . And then the description of the cider . . . Ard ! Thet cider was arder than [a miser ’s art or’n ole maid]558-a miser ’s art or’n ole maid ’s tongue . Body it ad . Strength it ad . Stans to reason . Ten year cider . Not a drop was drunk in [[Lordship]559-lordship ’s ouse]560-lordship ’s ouse under ten years in cask . Killed three sheep at week fer [[his]559-lordship indoor and outdoor servants]561-his indoor and outdoor servants . [An three hundred pigeons]562-an three hundred pigeons . The [pigeon - cotes]563-pigeon - cotes is a hundred feet high , an the pigeons ’ nesteses in oles in the inside walls . Clap - nests a ole wall at a go an takes the squabs . Times is not what [they]562-an three hundred pigeons Was , but is [Lordship]198-gunning keeps on . An always will ! [The man in the bed]550-the man in the bed — [Mark Tietjens]199-mark — continued [his]199-mark own thought . [Old Gunning]200-gunning lumbered slowly up [the path]565-the path towards [the stable]546-the stable , [his]200-gunning hands swinging . [The stable]546-the stable was [a tile - healed , thatched affair]568-a tile - healed , thatched affair , [no real stable in [the North Country sense]570-the north country sense]569-no real stable in the north country sense — [a place where [the old mare]572-the old mare sheltered among chickens and ducks]571-a place where the old mare sheltered among chickens and ducks . There was no tidiness amongst [South Country folk]573-south country folk . [They]573-south country folk had n’t it in [them]573-south country folk , though [Gunning]200-gunning could bind a tidy thatch and trim a hedge properly . [All - round man]574-all - round man . Really [an all - round man]575-an all - round man ; [he]574-all - round man could do a great many things . [He]574-all - round man knew all about fox - hunting , pheasant - rearing , wood - craft , hedging , dyking , pig - rearing and the habits of [King Edward]201-king edward when shooting . Smoking endless great cigars ! One finished , light another , throw away the stub . . . . ’ Fox - hunting , the sport of [kings]576-kings with only twenty per cent . of the danger of war ! [He]574-all - round man , [Mark Tietjens]199-mark , had never cared for hunting ; now [he]574-all - round man would never do any more ; [he]574-all - round man had never cared for pheasant - shooting . [He]574-all - round man would never do any more . Not could n’t ; would n’t . From henceforth . . . . It annoyed [him]574-all - round man that [he]574-all - round man had not taken the trouble to ascertain what it was [Iago]202-iago said , before [he]574-all - round man had taken [Iago]202-iago ’s resolution . . . . Took by the throat the circumciséd dog and smote [him]574-all - round man . . . . [Good man]578-good man , [Shakespeare]203-shakespeare ! All - round man in a way , too . Probably very like [Gunning]200-gunning . Knew [Queen Elizabeth]204-queen elizabeth ’s habits when hunting ; also very likely how to hedge , thatch , break up a deer or a hare or a hog , and how to serve a writ and write bad French . The ducks were making a great noise on [the pond up [the hill]581-the hill]580-the pond up the hill . [Old Gunning]200-gunning in the sunlight lumbered between [the stable]546-the stable - wall and the raspberry canes , up - hill . [The garden]583-the garden was all up - hill . [He]200-gunning looked across the grass up at the hedge . When [they]584-they turned [him]200-gunning round [he]200-gunning looked down - hill at [the house]585-the house . Rough , grey stone ! Now [he]200-gunning was looking up - hill across the tops of the hay - grass , over the raspberry canes at the hedge that [Gunning]200-gunning was going to trim . Full of consideration for [him]200-gunning , [they]584-they were , [all the lot of [them]584-they]589-all the lot of them . For ever thinking of developing [his]200-gunning possible interests . [The girl]593-the girl too long and thin in the legs and ankles , [her]593-the girl hair limp . War - starvation in early years . . . . Well , that was not his’fault . [He]200-gunning had managed [the nation]594-the nation ’s transport as it should be managed . [[His]200-gunning department]597-his department had . If [they]584-they had been hens there would have been something the matter — a dog chasing [them]584-they . [Ducks]206-ducks did not signify ; [they]584-they went mad , contagiously . Like nations and all the cattle of [a county]605-a county . [Gunning]200-gunning , lumbering past the raspberry canes , took a bud or so and squeezed the pale things between finger and thumb , then examined [his]200-gunning thumb . [Their]584-they commissariat was efficient enough , but [they]584-they were presumably not gross feeders . [Gunning]200-gunning began to brush the hedge , sharp , brushing blows with [his]200-gunning baggin hook . There was still far too much bramble amongst the quickset ; in a week the hedge would be unsightly again . That was part of [their]584-they consideration again ! [Marie Léonie]209-marie léonie — formerly Charlotte!—knew neither of [them]584-they by sight , though [she]611-she had undoubtedly seen [them]584-they peering over the hedge ! [They]584-they — it was more of [their]584-they considerateness — had contrived a shelf on the left corner - post of [[his]200-gunning shelter]612-his shelter . So that birds should amuse [him]200-gunning ! [A hedge - sparrow , noiseless and quaker - grey , ghost - like]613-a hedge - sparrow , noiseless and quaker - grey , ghost - like , was on this shelf . A thin , under - vitalized being that [you]614-you never saw . It flitted , hiding itself deep in hedge - rows . [He]200-gunning had always thought of it as [an American bird]615-an american bird : a voiceless nightingale , thin , long , thin - billed , almost without markings as becomes a bird that seldom sees the sun but lives in the twilight of deep hedges . American because it ought to wear a scarlet letter . The riotous tom - tit , the bottle - tit , the great - tit , all that family love dripping . [The hedge - sparrow]619-the hedge - sparrow obviously did not ; the dripping on that warmish June day had become oleaginous ; the hedge - sparrow , its bill all greased , mumbled its upper and lower mandible but took no more dripping . [It]619-the hedge - sparrow looked at [Mark]199-mark ’s eyes . Because these regarded it motionlessly , it uttered a long warning note and flitted , noiseless , into invisibility . All hedge things ignore [you]614-you whilst [you]614-you move on and do not regard them . The moment [you]614-you stay still and fix [your]614-you eyes on [them]620-them [they]620-them warn the rest of the hedge and flit off . This hedge - sparrow no doubt had its young within earshot . Or the warning might have been just cooperative . [Marie Léonie]209-marie léonie , [née Riotor]621-née riotor , was coming up the steps and then [the path]565-the path . [He]200-gunning could hear [her]623-she breathing . Mon pauvre homme ! Ce qu’ils ont fait de toi ! ” [She]623-she began a breathless discourse in French . [She]623-she was of [the large , blond , Norman type]624-the large , blond , norman type ; in the middle forties , [her]623-she extremely fair hair very voluminous and noticeable . [Her]623-she discourse poured on . [She]623-she had set the little tray with the plate of reddish - yellowish soup on a flat shelf of wood that turned out on a screw from underneath the bed ‘ ; in the soup was a shining clinical thermometer that [she]623-she moved and regarded from time to time , beside the plate a glass syringe , graduated . [She]623-she said that [Ils]211-ils — [they]211-ils — had combined to render [her]623-she soup of vegetables uneatable . [They]211-ils would not give [her]623-she most::1 : Pan ’ : but round ones , like buttons ; [they]211-ils contrived that the carrots should be pauvre at their bottom ends ; the leeks were of the consistency of wood . [They]211-ils were determined that [he]199-mark should not have vegetable soup because [they]211-ils wanted [him]199-mark to have meat juice . [They]211-ils were anthropophagi . Nothing but meat , meat , meat ! [That girl]627-that girl ! . . . That was a turnip to amuse [you]630-you ; to change and employ [your]630-you thoughts . [Her]623-she conversation had another quality that continually amused [him]199-mark : [she]623-she always ended it with the topic with which [she]623-she had chosen to begin . Thus , today having chosen to begin with newt : de [Paris]4-paris , with [Paris]4-paris turnips [she]623-she would end , and it amused [him]199-mark to observe how on each occasion [she]623-she would bring the topic back . [He]189-tietjens took in that [the King]724-the king ’s filly had won the Berkshire Foal plate and the horse of [a friend]725-a friend the Seaton Delaval Handicap , at [Newcastle]17-newcastle . Both might have been expected . [He]189-tietjens had meant to go to the [Newcastle]17-newcastle meeting this year and give [Newbury]20-newbury a by . Well , that was done with . [They]728-they would presumably bury [him]189-tietjens at [Groby]217-groby . [She]727-that bitch sylvia said in deep , rehearsed tones : “ [[My]0-i Man!”—she]729-my man!”—she might almost have well said : “ [My]0-i Deity!”—“What sort of life is this [we]730-we lead [here]731-here ? Was there ever anything so singular and unreasonable ? If [we]730-we sit to drink a cup of tea , the cup may at any moment be snatched from [our]730-we mouths ; if [we]730-we recline upon a divan — at any moment the divan may go . [I]0-i do not comment on this that [you]732-you lie by night as by day for ever here in the open air , for [I]0-i understand that it is by [your]732-you desire and consent that [you]732-you lie here and [I]0-i will never exhibit aversion from that which [you]732-you desire and that to which [you]732-you consent . But can not [you]732-you bring it about that [we]730-we should inhabit [a house of some reason]733-a house of some reason , one more suited to [human beings of this age]734-human beings of this age , and one that is less of a procession of goods and chattels ? [You]732-you can bring that about . [You]732-you are all - powerful [here]731-here . [I]0-i do not know what are [your]732-you resources . It was never [your]732-you habit to tell [me]0-i . [You]732-you kept [me]0-i in comfort . Never did [I]0-i express a desire that [you]732-you did not satisfy , though it is true that [my]0-i desires were always reasonable . So [I]0-i know nothing , though [I]0-i read once in a paper that [you]732-you were [a man of extravagant riches]736-a man of extravagant riches , and that can hardly all have vanished , for there can have been [fewer men of as great a frugality]737-fewer men of as great a frugality , and [you]732-you were always fortunate and moderate in [your]732-you wagers . [Sol]224-sol know nothing and [I]0-i would scorn to ask of [these others]738-these others , for that would imply doubt of [your]732-you trust in [me]0-i . [I]0-i do not doubt that [you]732-you have made arrangements for [my]0-i future comfort , and [I]0-i am in no uncertainty of the continuance of those arrangements . It is not material fears that [I]0-i have . But all this appears to be a madness . Why are [we]739-we here ? What is the meaning of all this ? Why do [you]732-you inhabit this singular erection ? It may be that the open air is of necessity for [your]732-you malady . [I]0-i do not believe that [you]732-you lived in perpetual currents of air in [[your]732-you chambers]740-your chambers , though [I]0-i never saw them . But on the days [you]732-you gave to [me]0-i [you]732-you had everything of the most comfortable and [you]732-you seemed contented with [my]0-i arrangements . And [[your]732-you brother]741-your brother and [[his]741-your brother Woman]634-his woman appear so mad in all the other affairs of life that [they]743-they may well be mad in this also . Why then will [you]732-you not end it ? [You]732-you have the power . [You]732-you are all - powerful here . [[Your]732-you brother]741-your brother will spring from one corner to the other of this lugubrious place in order to anticipate [your]732-you slightest wish . [Elle]219-elle , too ! ” Stretching out [her]219-elle hands , [she]219-elle had the air of [a Greek woman who invoked [a deity]746-a deity]745-a greek woman who invoked a deity , [she]219-elle was so large and fair and [her]219-elle hair was so luxuriantly blond . And indeed , to [her]219-elle , in [his]741-your brother mystery and silence [he]741-your brother had the air of [a deity who could discharge unthinkable darts and vouchsafe unimaginable favours]747-a deity who could discharge unthinkable darts and vouchsafe unimaginable favours . Though all [their]748-their circumstances had changed , that had not changed , so that even [his]741-your brother immobility enhanced [his]741-your brother mystery . In all [their]748-their life together , not merely here , [he]741-your brother had been silent whilst [she]219-elle had talked . On the two regular days of the week on which [he]741-your brother had been used to visit [her]219-elle , from the moment when [she]219-elle would open [her]219-elle door exactly at seven in the evening and see [him]741-your brother in [his]741-your brother bowler hat with [his]741-your brother carefully rolled umbrella and with [his]741-your brother racing glasses slung diagonally across [him]741-your brother to the moment when , next morning at half — past ten , [she]219-elle would brush [his]741-your brother bowler and hand [him]741-your brother that and [his]741-your brother umbrella , [he]741-your brother would hardly speak a word — [he]741-your brother would speak such few words as to give the idea of an absolute taciturnity , whilst [she]219-elle entertained [him]741-your brother with an unceasing flow of talk and of comments on the news of the Quartier — of [the French colonists of [that part of [London]22-london]750-that part of london]749-the french colonists of that part of london , or on the news in the French papers . [He]741-your brother would remain seated on a hard chair , bending slightly forward , with , round the corners of [his]741-your brother mouth , little creases that suggested an endless , indulgent smile . Occasionally [he]741-your brother would suggest that [she]219-elle should put half a sovereign upon a horse ; occasionally [he]741-your brother would bring [her]219-elle an opulent present , heavy gold bangles floridly chased and set with large emeralds , sumptuous furs , expensive travelling trunks for when [she]219-elle had visited [Paris]4-paris or went to [the seaside]751-the seaside in the autumn . That sort of thing . Once [he]741-your brother had bought [her]219-elle a complete set of the works of [Victor Hugo]225-victor hugo bound in purple morocco and all the works that had been illustrated by [Gustave Doré]226-gustave doré , in green calf ; once a hoof of a racehorse , trained in [France]18-france , set in silver in the form of an inkstand . On [her]219-elle forty — first birthday — though [she]219-elle had no idea how [he]741-your brother had ascertained that it was [her]219-elle forty - first birthday — [he]741-your brother had given [her]219-elle a string of pearls and had taken [her]219-elle to [a hotel at [Brighton]23-brighton kept by [an ex - prize - fighter]753-an ex - prize - fighter]752-a hotel at brighton kept by an ex - prize - fighter . [He]741-your brother had told [her]219-elle to wear the pearls at dinner , but to be careful of them because they had cost five hundred pounds . [He]741-your brother asked [her]219-elle once about [her]219-elle investment of [her]219-elle saving , and when [she]219-elle had told [him]741-your brother that [she]219-elle was investing in French rentes viagères [he]741-your brother had told [her]219-elle that [he]741-your brother could do better than that for [her]219-elle , and afterwards from time to time [he]741-your brother had told [her]219-elle of odd but very profitable ways of investing small sums . In this way , because [his]741-your brother gifts filled [her]219-elle with rapture on account of their opulence and weightiness , [he]741-your brother had assumed for [her]219-elle the aspect by degrees of [a godhead who could bless — and possibly blast — inscrutably]754-a godhead who could bless — and possibly blast — inscrutably . For many years after [he]741-your brother had first picked [her]219-elle up in [the Edgware Road]755-the edgware road outside [the old Apollo]756-the old apollo [she]219-elle had regarded [him]741-your brother with suspicion , since [he]741-your brother was [a man]757-a man and it is the nature of [men]758-men to treat [women]759-women with treachery , lust and meanness . Now [she]219-elle regarded [herself]219-elle as [the companion of [a godhead]761-a godhead , secure and immune from the evil workings of [Fortune]227-fortune]760-the companion of a godhead , secure and immune from the evil workings of fortune — as if [she]219-elle had been seated on the shoulder of one of [[Jove]228-jove ’s eagles]762-jove ’s eagles , beside [his]741-your brother throne . [The Immortals]763-the immortals had been known to choose [human companions]764-human companions : when [they]763-the immortals had so done fortunate indeed had been the lot of [the chosen]765-the chosen . Of [them]763-the immortals [she]219-elle felt [herself]219-elle to be [one]491-one . Even [his]741-your brother seizure had not deprived [her]219-elle of [her]219-elle sense of [his]741-your brother wide - spreading and inscrutable powers , and [she]219-elle could not rid [herself]219-elle of the conviction that if [he]741-your brother would , [he]741-your brother could talk , walk and perform the feats of strength of [a Hercules]767-a hercules . It was impossible not to think so ; the strength of [his]741-your brother glance was undiminished , and it was the dark glance of [a man , proud , vigorous , alert and commanding]768-a man , proud , vigorous , alert and commanding . And the mysterious nature and occurrence of the seizure itself only confirmed [her]219-elle subconscious conviction . The fit had come so undramatically that although the several pompous and , for [her]219-elle , nearly imbecile , [English physicians who had been called in to attend on [him]741-your brother]769-english physicians who had been called in to attend on him , agreed that some sort of fit must have visited [him]741-your brother as [he]741-your brother lay in [his]741-your brother bed , that had done nothing to change [her]219-elle mind . Indeed , even when [[her]219-elle own Doctor]770-her own doctor , [Drouant – Rouault]229-drouant – rouault , asserted with certitude and knowledge that this was a case of fulminant hemiplegia of a characteristic sort , though [her]219-elle reason accepted [his]741-your brother conclusion , [her]219-elle subconscious intuition remained the same . [Doctor Drouant]229-drouant – rouault – [Rouault]229-drouant – rouault was [a sensible man]771-a sensible man ; that [he]741-your brother had proved by pointing out the anatomical excellence of the works of sculpture by [Monsieur Casimir]214-bar – [Bar]214-bar and agreeing that only a conspiracy of [rivals]772-rivals could have prevented [his]741-your brother arriving at the post of [President of [the Ecole des Beaux Arts]774-the ecole des beaux arts]773-president of the ecole des beaux arts . [He]741-your brother was , then , [a man of sense]775-a man of sense and [his]741-your brother reputation amongst [the French tradesmen of the Quarter]776-the french tradesmen of the quarter stood very high : [she]219-elle had never [herself]219-elle needed the attentions of [a doctor]777-a doctor . But if [you]778-you needed [a doctor]777-a doctor , obviously [you]778-you went to [a Frenchman]780-a frenchman and acquiesced in what [he]780-a frenchman said . But although [she]219-elle acquiesced in words to [others]781-others , and indeed to [herself]219-elle , [she]219-elle could not convince [herself]219-elle in [her]219-elle for intérieur , nor indeed had [she]219-elle arrived at that amount of exterior conviction without some argument at least . [She]219-elle had pointed out , not only to [Doctor Drouant – Rouault]229-drouant – rouault , but [she]219-elle had even conceived it to be [her]219-elle duty to point out to [the English practitioners to whom [she]219-elle would not otherwise have spoken , that [the man lying there]783-the man lying there in [her]219-elle bed]782-the english practitioners to whom she would not otherwise have spoken , that the man lying there in her bed was [a North - countryman , from [Yorkshire]24-yorkshire , where [men were of an inconceivable obstinacy]785-men were of an inconceivable obstinacy]784-a north - countryman , from yorkshire , where men were of an inconceivable obstinacy . [She]219-elle had asked [them]786-them to consider that it was not unusual for [Yorkshire brothers]787-yorkshire brothers and [sisters]788-sisters or [other relatives]789-other relatives to live for decades together in [the same house]790-the same house and never address a word to [each other]791-each other , and [she]219-elle had pointed out that [she]219-elle knew [Mark Tietjens]199-mark to be of an unspeakable determination . [She]219-elle knew it from [their]792-their lifelong intimacy . [She]219-elle had never , for instance , been able to make [him]199-mark change [his]199-mark diet by an ounce in weight , or the shaking of a pepper — pot as to flavour — not once in twenty years during which [she]219-elle had cooked for [him]199-mark . [She]219-elle pleaded with [these gentlemen]793-these gentlemen to consider as a possibility that the terms of the Armistice were of such a nature as to make [a person of]794-a person of [Mark]199-mark ’s determination and idiosyncrasies resolve to withdraw [himself]199-mark for ever from [all human contacts]795-all human contacts , and that if [he]199-mark did so determine nothing would cause [him]199-mark to change [his]199-mark determination . The last word [he]199-mark had spoken had been whilst [one of [[his]199-mark colleagues at [the Ministry]798-the ministry]797-his colleagues at the ministry]796-one of his colleagues at the ministry had been telephoning to tell [her]219-elle , for [Mark]199-mark ’s information , what the terms of the Armistice were . At the news , which [she]219-elle had had to give [him]199-mark over [her]219-elle shoulder , [he]199-mark had made from the bed some remark.—He had been recovering from double pneumonia at the time.—What the remark had been [she]219-elle could not exactly repeat ; [she]219-elle was almost certain that it had been to the effect — in English — that [he]199-mark would never speak again . But [she]219-elle was aware that [her]219-elle own predilection was sufficient to bias [her]219-elle hearing . [She]219-elle had felt [herself]219-elle , at the news that [the Allies]799-the allies did not intend to pursue [the Germans]230-the germans into [[their]799-the allies [own country]801-own country]800-their own country — [she]219-elle had felt [herself]219-elle as if [she]219-elle could say to [the High Permanent Official at the other end of the telephone]802-the high permanent official at the other end of the telephone that [she]219-elle would never speak word to [him]199-mark and [his]199-mark race again . It was the first thing that had come into [her]219-elle mind , and no doubt it had been the first thing to come into [Mark]199-mark ’s . So [she]219-elle had pleaded with [the doctors]803-the doctors . [They]803-the doctors had paid practically no attention to [her]219-elle , and [she]219-elle was aware that that was very likely due to [her]219-elle ambiguous position as [the companion]804-the companion for long , without any legal security , of [a man whom [they]803-the doctors considered as now in no position to continue [his]805-a man whom they considered as now in no position to continue his protection of her protection of [her]219-elle]805-a man whom they considered as now in no position to continue his protection of her . That [she]219-elle in no way resented ; it was in the nature of [English male humanity]806-english male humanity . [The Frenchman]807-the frenchman had naturally listened with deference , bowing even a little . But [he]807-the frenchman had remarked with a sort of deaf obstinacy : [Madame]231-madame de maintenon must consider that the occasion of the stroke only made more certain that it was a stroke . And that argument to [her]219-elle , as [Frenchwoman]232-frenchwoman , must seem almost incontrovertible . For the betrayal of [France]18-france by [[her]219-elle Allies]808-her allies at the supreme moment of triumph had been a crime , the news of which might well cause the end of [the world]522-the world to seem desirable . Chapter 2

[SHE]219-elle continued to stand beside [him]807-the frenchman and to apostrophize [him]807-the frenchman until it should be time to turn round the framed newspaper so that [he]807-the frenchman could read the other side of the sheet . What [he]807-the frenchman read first contained the remarks of [various writers on racing]810-various writers on racing . That [he]807-the frenchman took in rapidly , as if it were a mere bonne bouche . [She]219-elle knew that [he]807-the frenchman regarded with contempt the opinions of [all writers on racing]811-all writers on racing , but [the two who wrote in this particular sheet with less contempt than the others]812-the two who wrote in this particular sheet with less contempt than the others . But the serious reading began when [she]219-elle turned the page . Here were endless , serried columns of the names of [race - horses]813-race - horses , [[their]813-race - horses jockeys]814-their jockeys and entrants at various race - meetings , [their]813-race - horses ages , ancestries , former achievements . That [he]807-the frenchman would peruse with minute attention that would cost [him]807-the frenchman just under an hour . [She]219-elle would have liked to stay with [him]807-the frenchman whilst [he]807-the frenchman read it , for the intensive study of matters connected with race - horses had always been [their]815-their single topic of communion . [She]219-elle had spent almost sentimental hours leaning over the back of [his]807-the frenchman arm - chair reading news of the turf simultaneously with [himself]807-the frenchman , and the compliments [he]807-the frenchman had been used to pay [her]219-elle over [her]219-elle predictions of Form , if they were the only compliments [he]807-the frenchman ever paid [her]219-elle , had filled [her]219-elle with the warm pleasure and confusion that [she]219-elle might have felt had [he]807-the frenchman addressed the same compliments to [her]219-elle on the subject of [her]219-elle person . [She]219-elle did not indeed need compliments from [him]807-the frenchman as to [her]219-elle person ; [his]807-the frenchman complete contentment with [her]219-elle sufficed — but [she]219-elle had rejoiced in , and now missed , those long , quiet times of communing . [She]219-elle remarked to [him]807-the frenchman indeed that [Seattle]233-seattle had won [her]233-seattle race as [she]219-elle had several days ago predicted because there had been [no other competitors in any way of the same class as the filly]816-no other competitors in any way of the same class as the filly , but there had been no answering , half - contemptuous grunt of acquiescence such as in the old days had been [hers]219-elle . [An aeroplane]817-an aeroplane had droned overhead and [she]219-elle had stepped out to look up at the bright toy that , shone upon by the sun , progressed slowly across the pellucid sky . When [she]219-elle went in , in answer to the double closing of [his]807-the frenchman lids that meant that [he]807-the frenchman acquiesced in the turning of [his]807-the frenchman news - sheet , [she]219-elle unhitched one brace from the oaken post to [his]807-the frenchman right and , walking round [his]807-the frenchman bed , attached the brace on the post to [his]807-the frenchman left , doing the reverse with the brace that had gone to the left . In that way the picture - frames turned completely round and exhibited the other side of the newspaper - frame . It was a contrivance that daily excited [her]219-elle annoyance and , as usual , [she]219-elle expressed [herself]219-elle . This was another instance of the madness of [They]818-they — of [[her]219-elle brother - in - law]674-her brother - in - law and [[his]807-the frenchman woman]634-his woman . Why had [they]818-they not obtained one of those ingenious machines , like an arm of bright brass supporting a reading - shelf of agreeably varnished mahogany , that [you]821-you clamped to a bedstead and could adjust at any angle ? Why indeed had [They]818-they not procured one of those huts for the tuberculous that [she]219-elle had seen depicted in a catalogue . [Such huts]822-such huts could be painted in agreeable stripes of green and vermilion , thus presenting a gay appearance , and they could be turned upon a pivot so as to meet the rays of the sun or avoid the currents of air caused by the wind ? What could be the explanation of this mad and gross structure ? A thatched roof supported on posts without walls ? Did [they]818-they desire [him]807-the frenchman to be blown out of [his]807-the frenchman bed by the draughts ? Did [They]818-they merely desire to enrage [her]219-elle ? Or could it be that [their]818-they resources were of such exiguity that [they]818-they could not afford the conveniences of modern civilization ? [She]219-elle might well have thought that to be the case . But how could it , in face of the singular behaviour of [Monsieur]823-monsieur [her]219-elle beau - frére in the matter of the statuary of [Casimir]214-bar – [Bar the great sculptor]824-bar the great sculptor . [She]219-elle had offered to contribute to the expenses of the establishment even at the cost of the sacrifice of what [she]219-elle held most dear , and how singular had been [his]807-the frenchman behaviour . During [their]818-they absence on the occasion of the great sale at [Wingham Priory]25-wingham priory [she]219-elle had ordered [the amiable if gross Gunning]200-gunning and [the semi - imbecile carpenter]825-the semi - imbecile carpenter to descend from [[her]219-elle room]826-her room to [the salon that admirable [Niob]234-niob]827-the salon that admirable niob : and [the admittedly incomparable Tbeti]828-the admittedly incomparable tbeti : informing [Neptune]235-neptune of the death of [a Son - in - law]829-a son - in - law , not to mention [[her]219-elle newly regilt Second Empire fauteuil]830-her newly regilt second empire fauteuil . And in [that gloomy wilderness]831-that gloomy wilderness how had [they]818-they not shone in [their]818-they respective whiteness and auriference ! The pose of [the Niobe]218-niobe how passionate , the action of [the Tbeti]236-the tbeti : how spirited and how at the same time pathetic ! And [she]219-elle had seized the opportunity to varnish with a special preparation imported from [the City of the Arts]832-the city of the arts the only chair in [the salon]673-the salon that was not too rough to be susceptible of varnish even though it came from [Paris]4-paris [herself]219-elle . A clumsy affair at that — of the epoch of Louis [the Thirteenth of [France]18-france]26-the thirteenth of france , though heaven knew whose epoch that was here . Without doubt that of [Cromwell the regicide]237-cromwell the regicide ! And [Monsieur]834-monsieur must needs seize ‘ the moment of [his]834-monsieur entry on this thus enlivened scene to exhibit the only display of emotion that [she]219-elle had ever known [him]834-monsieur vouchsafe . For otherwise [Monsieur]835-monsieur had the pose of being at least as self - contained if not as absolutely taciturn as [Mark]199-mark [himself]835-monsieur . [She]219-elle asked [Mark]199-mark : was that the moment for what was after all if [you]836-you analysed it a manifestation of attachment for [[his]835-monsieur young woman]837-his young woman ? What else could it be ? ll — [Monsieur]838-monsieur [[their]839-their relative]840-their relative , passed for [a man of unbounded knowledge]841-a man of unbounded knowledge . [He]835-monsieur knew all knowledge . [He]835-monsieur could not but be aware of the supreme value of the work of [Casimir]214-bar – [Bar]214-bar who , but for the machinations of [[his]835-monsieur rival]842-his rival [Monsieur Rodin]238-monsieur rodin and [[his]835-monsieur confréres]843-his confréres , must have attained to the highest honours in [France]18-france . But not only had [Monsieur]844-monsieur with hisses and tut - tuts of anger ordered [Gunning]200-gunning and [the carpenter]845-the carpenter at once to remove the statuary and the fauteuil from [the salon where [she]837-his young woman had exhibited them]846-the salon where she had exhibited them — with heaven knew how much reluctance — with a view to [their]847-their attracting the attention of [a chance customer]848-a chance customer — for [chance customers]849-chance customers did come in [Their]849-chance customers absence without rendezvous . . . . Not only that , but [Monsieur]850-monsieur , to gratify the perhaps not unnatural envy of [Elle]219-elle , had cast meretricious doubts on the pecuniary value of the works of [Casimir]214-bar – [Bar]214-bar [them]851-them - selves . [Every one]852-every one knew how [the Americans today]853-the americans today were stripping [the unfortunate land of [France]18-france]854-the unfortunate land of france of [her]837-his young woman choicest art treasures ; the enormous prices [they]853-the americans today paid ; the avidity [they]853-the americans today showed . Yet [that man]855-that man had tried to persuade [her]837-his young woman that [her]837-his young woman statues were worth no more than a few shillings apiece . It was incomprehensible . [He]855-that man was in want of money to the extent of turning [[their]856-they house]857-their house into [a mere depot for dilapidated objects in rough wood and battered brass]858-a mere depot for dilapidated objects in rough wood and battered brass . [He]855-that man had contrived to obtain singular prices for these forlorn objects from [insane Yankees who came great distances to purchase these debris from [him]855-that man]859-insane yankees who came great distances to purchase these debris from him . Yet when [he]855-that man was offered pieces of the utmost beauty in the most perfect condition [he]855-that man just simply turned the objects down with scoffing . For [herself]837-his young woman , [she]837-his young woman respected passion — though [she]837-his young woman could have imagined an object of passion more calculated to excite that feeling than [Elle]219-elle , whom for convenience [she]837-his young woman would call [her]837-his young woman ball:—mar . [She]837-his young woman at least was broad - minded , and moreover [she]837-his young woman understood the workings of the human heart . It was creditable for [a man]757-a man to ruin [himself]757-a man for the object of [his]757-a man affections . But this at least [she]837-his young woman found exaggerated . And what , then , was this determination to ignore the developments of modern genius ? Why would [they]856-they not purchase for [Mark]199-mark a reading - desk with a brass arm that should indicate to [the neighbours and dependents]861-the neighbours and dependents that at least [he]855-that man was [a person of condition]862-a person of condition ? Why no revolving hut ? There were certain symptoms of that age that were disquieting . [She]837-his young woman would be the first to acknowledge that . [They]856-they ’ had only to read in the papers of the deeds of [assassins]863-assassins , [highway robbers]864-highway robbers , of [the subversive]865-the subversive and [the ignorant who everywhere seized the reins of power]866-the ignorant who everywhere seized the reins of power . But what was to be said against such innocent things as the reading — desk , [the revolving hut]867-the revolving hut and [the aeroplane]868-the aeroplane . Yes , [the aeroplane]868-the aeroplane ! Why did [they]856-they ignore [the aeroplane]868-the aeroplane ? [They]856-they had told [her]837-his young woman that the reason why [they]856-they had been unable to provide [her]837-his young woman with nawt : dt Pari : was that the season was becoming too advanced for the sowing of the seeds of those admirable and amusing vegetables which , seen advancing through the pale electric lights of the early hours of the morning , piled symmetrically as high as [the first floors of [the hotels]872-the hotels]871-the first floors of the hotels , on [the market - carts]873-the market - carts , provided one of the gayest spectacles of the night - life of [la Ville Lumiére]27-la ville lumiére . [They]856-they had said that to procure the seeds from [Paris]4-paris would demand at least a month . But supposing [they]856-they had sent a letter by [aeroplane]874-aeroplane , requesting the dispatch of the seeds equally by [aeroplane]874-aeroplane , to procure them , as all [the world]522-the world knew , would be a matter merely of a few hours . And , having thus brought the matter back to turnips again , [she]837-his young woman concluded : “ Yes , [mon pauvre homme]720-mon pauvre homme , [they]856-they have singular natures , [[our]878-our relatives]879-our relatives — for [I]0-i will include [the young woman]880-the young woman in that category . [I]0-i , at least , am broad - minded enough for that . But [they]856-they have singular natures . It is a singular affair ! ” ‘ [She]837-his young woman departed up the path towards [the stable]546-the stable , speculating on the nature of [[[her]837-his young woman man]882-her man ’s relatives]883-her man ’s relatives . [They]856-they were [the relatives of [a godhead—«but god - heads]885-a godhead—«but god - heads]884-the relatives of a godhead—«but god - heads had [relatives of a singular nature]886-relatives of a singular nature . Let [Mark]199-mark figure as [Jupiter]239-jupiter ; well , [Jupiter]239-jupiter had [a son called [Apollo]240-apollo who could not be regarded as exactly [fis de famille]888-fis de famille]887-a son called apollo who could not be regarded as exactly fis de famille . [His]887-a son called apollo who could not be regarded as exactly fis de famille adventures had been of the most irregular . Was it not known that [he]887-a son called apollo who could not be regarded as exactly fis de famille had spent a long space of time with [the shepherds of [King Admetus]241-king admetus]889-the shepherds of king admetus , singing and carousing ? Well , [Monsieur Tietjens]242-monsieur tietjens might for convenience be regarded as a sort of [Apollo]240-apollo , now amongst [the shepherds of Admetus and complete with female companion]890-the shepherds of admetus and complete with female companion . If [he]242-monsieur tietjens did not often sing , [he]242-monsieur tietjens also concealed the tendencies that had brought about [his]242-monsieur tietjens downfall . [He]242-monsieur tietjens was quiet enough about [the house]585-the house , extraordinary as [the house]585-the house might be . [Elle]219-elle also . If [their]893-their relationship was irregular it presented no aspects of reprehensible festivity . It was a sufficiently serious tollagt . That at least ran in [the family]894-the family . [She]219-elle came round the rough balks of the side of [the stable]546-the stable upon [Gunning]200-gunning , seated on the stone — sill of the door , cutting with a broad - bladed clasp - knife considerable chunks out of a large meat pasty . [She]219-elle surveyed [his]200-gunning extended leggings , [his]200-gunning immense bemired boots and [his]200-gunning unshaven countenance and remarked in French that [the shepherds of [Admetus]241-king admetus]896-the shepherds of admetus were probably differently dressed . [They]896-the shepherds of admetus certainly were in all the performances of [the Altai]243-the altai : that [she]219-elle had seen . But perhaps [he]200-gunning served [his]200-gunning turn . [Gunning]200-gunning said that [he]200-gunning supposed [he]200-gunning had to go on duty again . [She]219-elle , [he]200-gunning supposed , was going to bottle off the cider or [she]219-elle would not have had [him]200-gunning bring down that ere cask . [She]219-elle was to be careful to tie the carks tight ; it would get itself a ed proper . [She]219-elle said that if [she]219-elle , [a Norman of a hundred generations]897-a norman of a hundred generations , did not know how to handle cider it would be a strange thing , and [he]200-gunning said that it would be a pity if that cider went wrong after all the trouble [they]898-they ad ad . [He]200-gunning brushed the crumbs of [his]200-gunning demolished pie off the cords of [his]200-gunning breeches , carefully picking up the larger fragments of crust and inserting them into [his]200-gunning month between [his]200-gunning broad red lips . [He]200-gunning asked if [er Ladyship]244-er ladyship knew whether [the Cahptn]245-the cahptn wanted [the mare]899-the mare that afternoon . If not [e]900-e might ’s well turn er on [the Common]901-the common . [She]219-elle said that [she]219-elle did not know ; [the Captain]902-the captain had said nothing to [her]219-elle about it . [He]902-the captain said [he]902-the captain supposed [e]900-e might ’s well . [Cramp]246-cramp said [e]900-e would not have the settee ready to go to [the station fore mornin]903-the station fore mornin . If [she]219-elle would wait [there]537-there [he]900-e would go git some tepid water and [they]905-they would moisten the eggs . [She]219-elle did not ask better . [He]900-e scrambled to [his]900-e feet and lumbered down [the stone path]906-the stone path towards [the house]585-the house . [She]219-elle stood in the bright day regarding the long grass of [the orchard]609-the orchard , the gnarled , whitened trunks of the fruit trees , the little lettuces like aligned rosettes in the beds , and the slope of [the land]909-the land towards the old stones of [the house]585-the house that the boughs of the apple — trees mostly hid . And [she]219-elle acknowledged that , in effect , [she]219-elle did not ask better . [A Norman]247-a norman , if [Mark]199-mark had died in the ordinary course , [she]219-elle would no doubt have gone back to [the neighbourhood either of [Falaise]28-falaise]911-the neighbourhood either of falaise or [Bayeux]29-bayeux , from which places came [the families of [[her]219-elle grand - father]913-her grand - father and [grand - mother]914-grand - mother respectively]912-the families of her grand - father and grand - mother respectively . [She]219-elle would probably have married [a rich farmer]915-a rich farmer or [a rich grazier]916-a rich grazier , and , by choice , [she]219-elle would have pursued a life of bottling off cider and moistening the eggs of sitting hens . [She]219-elle had had [her]219-elle training as [a coryphée at the [Paris]4-paris opera]917-a coryphée at the paris opera , and no doubt if [she]219-elle had not made [her]219-elle visit to [London]22-london with [the Paris opera troupe]918-the paris opera troupe and if [Mark]199-mark had not picked [her]219-elle up in [the [Edgware]30-edgware Road where [[her]219-elle lodgings]920-her lodgings had been]919-the edgware road where her lodgings had been , [she]219-elle would have lived similarly with [some man in [Clichy]31-clichy or [Auteuil]32-auteuil]921-some man in clichy or auteuil until with [her]219-elle economies [she]219-elle would have been able , equally , to retire to one or other of [the pays of [[her]219-elle families]923-her families]922-the pays of her families , and marry [a farmer]924-a farmer , [a butcher]925-a butcher , or [a grazier]926-a grazier . [She]219-elle acknowledged , for the matter of that , that [she]219-elle would probably not have raised more succulent poulets au grain or more full - bodied cider than came from the nest - boxes and the presses here , and that [she]219-elle was leading no other life than that which [she]219-elle had always contemplated . Nor , indeed , would [she]219-elle have wanted [any other henchman]927-any other henchman than [Gunning]200-gunning who , if [you]928-you had given [him]200-gunning a blue blouse with stitchery and a casquette with a black leather peak , would have passed for [any peasant in [Caen market]930-caen market]929-any peasant in caen market . [He]200-gunning swung up [the path]565-the path , carrying gingerly a large blue bowl , just as if [his]200-gunning blouse bellied out round [him]200-gunning ; [he]200-gunning had the same expression of the mouth ; the same intonation . It was nothing that [she]219-elle obstinately spoke French to [him]200-gunning . On [[his]200-gunning subjects]932-his subjects [he]200-gunning could tell by intuition what [her]219-elle answers to [his]200-gunning questions were and [she]219-elle understood [him]200-gunning well enough . [He]200-gunning said that [he]200-gunning had better take the ens off the nesteses fer fear [they]933-they peck er ands , and giving [her]219-elle the bowl , brought out from the shadows a protesting , ruffled and crooning hen , before which [he]200-gunning dropped a handful of bran paste and a lettuce leaf . [He]200-gunning came out with another and yet others . Then [he]200-gunning said [she]219-elle could go in and sprinkle the eggs . [He]200-gunning said that it always bothered [him]200-gunning to turn the eggs ; [his]200-gunning clumsy ol ands bruk em ’s often as not . [He]200-gunning said : “ Wait whilst [I]0-i brings out [ol mare]934-ol mare . Bit o grass wunt do er much mischief . ” The hens , swollen to an enormous size , paraded hostilely against one another about [her]219-elle feet ; [they]933-they clucked ; crooned ; pecked at lumps of paste ; drank water eagerly from an iron dog - trough . With an exaggerated clatter of hoofs [old mare]935-old mare emerged from [the stable]546-the stable . [She]935-old mare was aged nineteen , obstinate , bitter , very dark bay , extremely raw - boned . [You]937-you might fill [her]935-old mare with oats and mash five times a day but [she]935-old mare would not put on flesh . [She]935-old mare emerged into the light from the door with the trot of a prima - donna , for [she]935-old mare knew [she]935-old mare had once been [a famous creature]938-a famous creature . [The hens]939-the hens fled ; [she]935-old mare bit into the air , showing immense teeth . [Gunning]200-gunning opened the orchard gate , just at hand ; [she]935-old mare went out at a canter ; checked ; crumpled [her]935-old mare knees together ; fell on [her]935-old mare side and rolled and rolled ; [her]935-old mare immense lean legs were incongruous , up in the air . “ Yes , ” [Marie Léonie]209-marie léonie said , “ pour moi - meme je ne demanderais pas mieux ‘ . ” [Gunning]200-gunning remarked : “ Do n’t show [er]940-er age , do [she]935-old mare ? Gambolling like a five day lamb ! ” [His]200-gunning voice was full of pride , [his]200-gunning grey face joyful . Is [Lordship]198-gunning once sed that ol mare had orter be put in the Orse Show up to [Lunnon]33-lunnon . Some yeers ago that was ! [She]935-old mare went into the dark , warm , odorous depths of [the hen - house]941-the hen - house — [stable shed]942-stable shed ; the horse - box being divided off from the hen half by wire netting , nest - boxes , blankets extended on use - poles . [She]935-old mare had to bend down to get into the hen - half . The cracks of light between the uprights of the walls blinked at [her]935-old mare . [She]935-old mare carried the bowl of tepid water gingerly , and thrust [her]935-old mare hand into the warm hay hollows . The eggs were fever — heat or thereabouts ; [she]935-old mare turned them and sprinkled in the tepid water ; thirteen , fourteen , fourteen , eleven — That hen was a breaker!—and fifteen . [She]935-old mare emptied out the tepid water and from other nests took out egg after egg . The acquisition gratified [her]935-old mare . In an upper box a hen brooded low . [It]943-it crooned menacingly , then screamed with the voice of poultry disaster as [her]935-old mare hand approached it . The sympathetic voices of [other hens outside]944-other hens outside came to [her]935-old mare , screaming with poultry disaster — and other hens on [the Common]901-the common . A rooster crowed . [She]935-old mare repeated to [herself]935-old mare that [she]935-old mare did not demand a better life than this . But was it not self - indulgence to be so contented ? Ought [she]935-old mare not to be , still , taking steps for [her]935-old mare future — near [Falaise]28-falaise or [Bayeux]29-bayeux ? Did [one]491-one not owe that to [oneself]491-one ? How long would this life last here ? And , still more , when it broke up , how would it break up ? What would [Il:—the strange people]947-il:—the strange people , do to [her]935-old mare , [her]935-old mare savings , [her]935-old mare furs , trunks , pearls , turquoises , statuary , and newly - gilt Second Empire chairs and clocks ? When [the Sovereign]948-the sovereign died what did [the Heir]949-the heir , [[his]949-the heir concubines]950-his concubines , [courtiers]951-courtiers and [sycophants]952-sycophants do to [the Maintenon of the day]953-the maintenon of the day ? What precautions ought [she]935-old mare not to be taking against that wrath to come ? There must be [French lawyers in [London]22-london]954-french lawyers in london . . . . Was it to be thought that [Il]248-il — [Christopher Tietjens]249-christopher , [clumsy , apparently slow — witted but actually gifted with the insight of the supernatural]955-clumsy , apparently slow — witted but actually gifted with the insight of the supernatural . . . . [Gunning]198-gunning would say : [The Captain]902-the captain , [he]902-the captain never says anything , but who knows what [he]902-the captain thinks ? [He]902-the captain perceives everything . . . . Was it to be thought then that , once [Mark]199-mark was dead and [he]199-mark actual owner of [the place called [Groby]217-groby]957-the place called groby and [the vast stretch of coal - bearing land]958-the vast stretch of coal - bearing land that the newspaper had spoken of , [Christopher Tietjens]249-christopher would maintain [his]199-mark benevolent and frugal dispositions of today ? It was truly thinkable . But , just as [he]199-mark appeared slow — witted and was actually gifted with the insight of the supernatural , so [he]199-mark might well now maintain this aspect of despising wealth and yet develop into [a true Harpagon]959-a true harpagon as soon as [he]199-mark held the reins of power . [The rich]960-the rich are noted for hardness of heart , and [brother]961-brother will prey upon [brother]961-brother ’s widow sooner than on another . ’ So that , certainly , [she]249-christopher ought to put [herself]249-christopher under the protection of [the Authorities]250-the authorities . But then , what [Authorities]250-the authorities ? [The long arm of [France]18-france]963-the long arm of france would no doubt protect one of [her]249-christopher nationals even in [this remote and uncivilized land]964-this remote and uncivilized land . But would it be possible to put that machinery in motion without the knowledge of [Mark]199-mark — and what dreadful steps might [Mark]199-mark not take in [his]199-mark wrath if [he]199-mark thought that [she]249-christopher had set machinery in motion ? There appeared nothing for it but to wait , and that side of [her]249-christopher nature being indolent , perhaps being alone indolent , [she]249-christopher was aware that [she]249-christopher was contented to wait . But was such a course right ? Was it doing justice to [herself]249-christopher or to [France]18-france ? For it is the duty of [the French citizen]965-the french citizen , by industry , frugality and vigilance , to accumulate goods ; and it was above all the duty of [the French citizen]965-the french citizen to carry back accumulated hoards to [that distressed country]967-that distressed country , stripped bare as [she]249-christopher was by [the perfidious Allies]968-the perfidious allies . [She]249-christopher might [herself]249-christopher rejoice in these circumstances , these grasses , [orchards]969-orchards , poultry , cider - presses , [vegetable - gardens]970-vegetable - gardens — even if the turnips were not of the [Paris]4-paris Mott variety ! [She]249-christopher might not ask for better . But there might be [a little pays , near [Falaise]28-falaise]971-a little pays , near falaise , or , in the alternative , near [Bayeux]29-bayeux , [a little spot that [she]249-christopher might enrich with these spoils from [the barbarians]973-the barbarians]972-a little spot that she might enrich with these spoils from the barbarians . If [every inhabitant of a pay]974-every inhabitant of a pay : in [France]18-france did the same would not [France]18-france again be prosperous , with all [its]18-france clochers tolling out contentment across [smiling acres]975-smiling acres ? Well , then ! Standing gazing at the poultry , whilst Gunning with a hone smoothed out some notches from [his]976-his baggin hook , previous to again going on duty , [she]249-christopher began to reflect on the nature of [Christopher Tietjens]249-christopher , for [she]249-christopher desired to estimate what were [her]249-christopher chances of retaining [her]249-christopher furs , pearls and gilt articles of vertu . . . . By the orders of [the doctor who attended daily on [Mark]199-mark]977-the doctor who attended daily on mark — [a dry , sandy , no doubt perfectly ignorant person]978-a dry , sandy , no doubt perfectly ignorant person — [Mark]199-mark was never to be left out of sight . [He]199-mark was of opinion , [this doctor]979-this doctor , that one day [Mark]199-mark might move — physically . And there might be great danger if ever [he]199-mark did move . The lesions , if lesions there were in [his]199-mark brain , might then be restarted with fatal effects.—Some such talk . So [they]980-they must never let [him]199-mark out of [their]980-they sight . For the night [they]980-they had an alarm that was connected by a wire from [his]199-mark bed to [hers]249-christopher . [Hers]249-christopher was in [a room that gave onto [the orchard]609-the orchard]981-a room that gave onto the orchard . If [he]199-mark so much as stirred in [his]199-mark bed the bell would ring in [her]249-christopher ear . But indeed [she]249-christopher rose every night , over and over again , to look from [her]249-christopher window into [[his]199-mark hut]983-his hut ; a dim lantern illuminated [his]199-mark sheets . These arrangements appeared to [her]249-christopher to be barbarous , but they met the views of [Mark]199-mark and [she]249-christopher was thus in no position to question [them]980-they . . . . So [she]249-christopher had to wait whilst [Gunning]198-gunning honed out [his]199-mark sickle - shaped , short - handled blade . It had all then begun — all the calamities of [the world]522-the world had begun amidst the clamours and intoxications of that dreadful day . Of [Christopher Tietjens]249-christopher till then [she]249-christopher had known little or nothing . For the matter of that of [Mark]199-mark [himself]199-mark [she]249-christopher had known little or nothing until a very few years ago . [She]249-christopher had known neither [his]199-mark name , nor how [he]199-mark occupied [himself]199-mark , not yet where [he]199-mark lived . ‘ It had not been [her]249-christopher business to inquire , so [she]249-christopher had never made inquiries . Then one day — after thirteen years — [he]199-mark had awakened one morning with an attack of bronchitis after a very wet Newmarket Craven Meeting . [He]199-mark had told [her]249-christopher to go to [[his]199-mark Office]985-his office with a note addressed to [[his]199-mark chief clerk]986-his chief clerk . to ask for [his]199-mark letters and to tell [them]986-his chief clerk to send [a messenger]987-a messenger to [[his]199-mark chambers]988-his chambers to get some clothes and necessaries . When [she]249-christopher had told [him]199-mark that [she]249-christopher did not know what [[his]199-mark Office]985-his office was nor where were [[his]199-mark chambers]988-his chambers , nor even [his]199-mark surname , [he]199-mark had grunted . [He]199-mark had expressed neither surprise nor gratification , but [she]249-christopher knew that [he]199-mark had been gratified — probably with [himself]199-mark for having ‘ chosen [a woman companion who displayed no curiosity]991-a woman companion who displayed no curiosity rather than with [her]249-christopher for having displayed none . After that [he]199-mark had had a telephone installed in [[her]249-christopher rooms]992-her rooms , and not infrequently [he]199-mark would stay later of a morning than had been [his]199-mark habit , letting [a messenger from [the Office]994-the office]993-a messenger from the office bring letters or fetch documents that [he]199-mark had signed . When [[his]199-mark father]670-his father had died [he]199-mark had put [her]249-christopher into mourning . By that date , gradually , [she]249-christopher had learned that [he]199-mark was [Mark Tietjens]199-mark of [Groby]217-groby , [an immense estate somewhere in [the North]34-the north]996-an immense estate somewhere in the north . [He]199-mark employed [himself]199-mark at [an Office of [the Government]998-the government ’s in [Whitehall]35-whitehall]997-an office of the government ’s in whitehall — apparently with questions of railways . [She]249-christopher gathered , chiefly from ejaculations of [the Messenger]999-the messenger , that [he]199-mark treated [[his]199-mark Ministry]1000-his ministry with contempt , but was regarded as so indispensable that [he]199-mark never lost [his]199-mark post . Occasionally , [the Office]994-the office would ring up and ask [her]249-christopher if [she]249-christopher knew where [he]199-mark was . [She]249-christopher would gather from the papers afterwards that that was because there had been a great railway accident . On those occasions [he]199-mark would have been absent at a race — meeting . [He]199-mark gave [the Office]994-the office , in fact , just as much of [his]199-mark time as [he]199-mark chose , no more and no less . [She]249-christopher gathered that , with [his]199-mark overpowering wealth , it was of no account to [him]199-mark except as an occupation of leisure time between meetings , and [she]249-christopher gathered that [he]199-mark was regarded as [an occult power amongst [the rulers of [the nation]594-the nation]1004-the rulers of the nation]1003-an occult power amongst the rulers of the nation . Once , during the War when [he]199-mark had hurt [his]199-mark hand , [he]199-mark dictated to [her]249-christopher a note of a confidential nature to one of [the Cabinet Ministers]1006-the cabinet ministers . It had concerned itself with [Transport]251-transport and its tone had been that of singular , polite contempt . For [her]249-christopher [he]199-mark was in no way astonishing . [He]199-mark was [the English Milor with le Spleen]1007-the english milor with le spleen . [She]249-christopher had read of [him]199-mark in the novels of [Alexander Dumas]252-alexander dumas , [Paul de Kock]253-paul de kock , [Eugene Sue]254-eugene sue and [Ponson du Terrail]255-ponson du terrail . [He]199-mark represented [the England]1008-the england that [the Continent]1009-the continent applauded — [the only [England]15-england that [the Continent]1009-the continent]1010-the only england that the continent applauded . Silent , obstinate , inscrutable , insolent but immensely wealthy and uncontrollably generous . For [herself]249-christopher , elle ne demandait pas mieux . For there was about [him]199-mark nothing of the unexpected . [He]199-mark was as regular as [the Westminster Chimes]256-the westminster chimes ; [he]199-mark never exacted the unexpected of [her]249-christopher and [he]199-mark was all - powerful and never in the wrong . [He]199-mark was , in short , what [[her]249-christopher country - women]1012-her country - women called sérieux . [No Frenchwoman]1013-no frenchwoman asks better than that of [lover]1014-lover or [husband]1015-husband . It was the serious collage par excellence : [they]1016-they as [a ménage]1017-a ménage , were sober , honest , frugal , industrious , immensely wealthy , and seriously saving . For [his]199-mark dinner , twice a week , [she]249-christopher cooked [him]199-mark [herself]249-christopher two mutton n chops with all but an eighth of an inch of the fat pared off , two mealy potatoes , as light and as white as flour , an apple — pie with a very flaky crust which [he]199-mark ate with a wedge of Stilton and some pulled bread and butter . This dinner was never varied once in twenty years , except during the season of game , when on alternate weeks a pheasant , a brace of grouse or of partridges would come from [Groby]217-groby . Nor in the twenty years had [they]1018-they once been separated for a whole week except that every late summer [he]199-mark spent a month at [Harrogate]36-harrogate . [She]249-christopher always had [his]199-mark dress — shirts washed for [him]199-mark by [[her]249-christopher own laundress]1019-her own laundress in [the Quartier]1020-the quartier . [He]199-mark spent almost every week - end in [one country house]1021-one country house or another , using at most two dress - shirts and that only if [he]199-mark stayed till Tuesday . [English people of good class]1022-english people of good class do not dress for dinner on Sundays . That is a politeness to [God]257-god , because theoretically [you]1023-you attend evening service and [you]1023-you do not go to [church]1024-church in [the country]1025-the country in evening dress . As a matter of fact [you]1023-you never go to evening service — but it is complimentary to suggest by [your]1023-you dress that [you]1023-you might be visited by [the impulse]1026-the impulse . So , at least , [Marie Léonie Tietjens]209-marie léonie understood the affair . [She]249-christopher was looking out on [the Common that sloped up to beech trees]1027-the common that sloped up to beech trees , at the poultry — bright chestnut birds , extremely busy on the intense green of the browsed grass . The great rooster reminded [her]249-christopher of the late [Monsieur Rodin]238-monsieur rodin , [the sculptor who had conspired against [Casimir – Bar]214-bar]1028-the sculptor who had conspired against casimir – bar . [She]249-christopher had once seen [him]199-mark in [[his]199-mark studio]1029-his studio , conducting [some American ladies]1030-some american ladies round [his]199-mark work , and [he]199-mark had precisely resembled a rooster kicking [its]199-mark leg back and drooping its wings in the dust round a new hen . Only round a new one . Naturally ! . . . [This rooster]1031-this rooster was [a tremendous Frenchman]1032-a tremendous frenchman . Un vrai de la vraie . [You]1023-you could imagine nothing more unlike [Christopher Tietjens]249-christopher ! . . . The backward - raking legs on the dancing toes ; the gait of [a true master of deportment]1033-a true master of deportment at [an academy of [young ladies]1035-young ladies]1034-an academy of young ladies ! The vigilant clear eye cocking up every minute . . . . Hark ! A swift shadow ran over [the ground]1036-the ground : the sparrow - hawk ! The loud , piercing croon of [that Father of [[his]1037-that father of his country Country]1038-his country]1037-that father of his country . How [the hens]939-the hens all re - echoed it ; how the chickens ran to [[their]939-the hens mothers]1040-their mothers and all together to the shadow of the hedge . [Monsieur]1041-monsieur , [the hawk]1042-the hawk would have no chance amidst that outcry . The hawk flits silent and detests noise . It will bring [the poultry - keeper]1043-the poultry - keeper with [his]1043-the poultry - keeper gun ! . . . All is discovered because of the vigilance of [Milord Chantecler]258-milord chantecler . . . . There are those who reprove [him]258-milord chantecler because [his]258-milord chantecler eyes are always on the sky , because [he]258-milord chantecler has a proud head . But that is [his]258-milord chantecler function — that and gallantry . Perceive [him]258-milord chantecler with a grain of corn ; how [he]258-milord chantecler flies upon it ; how [he]258-milord chantecler invites with cries ! [[His]258-milord chantecler favourite]1044-his favourite — [the newest — hens]1045-the newest — hens run ducking joyously to [him]258-milord chantecler . How [he]258-milord chantecler bows , droops and prances , holding the grain of corn in [his]258-milord chantecler powerful bill , « depositing it , pecking to bruise it and then depositing ‘ before [his]258-milord chantecler sultana of the moment . Nor will [he]258-milord chantecler complain if a little ball of fluff runs quickly and pecks the grain from [his]258-milord chantecler bill before [Madame Partlet]259-madame partlet can take it from [him]258-milord chantecler . [His]258-milord chantecler gallantry has been wasted , but [he]258-milord chantecler is [a good father]1046-a good father ! . . . Perhaps there is not even a grain of corn when [he]258-milord chantecler issues [his]258-milord chantecler invitations ; perhaps [he]258-milord chantecler merely calls [[his]258-milord chantecler favourites]1047-his favourites to [him]258-milord chantecler that [he]258-milord chantecler may receive [their]1047-his favourites praise or perform the act of Love . . . .
