When [he]258-milord chantecler smites [his]258-milord chantecler wing feathers behind [his]258-milord chantecler back and utters [his]258-milord chantecler clarion cry of victory over the hawk that now glides far away down [the hill]581-the hill , [his]258-milord chantecler hens come out again from the shadows , the chickens from beneath [[their]1051-their mothers]1040-their mothers ’ wings . [He]258-milord chantecler has given security to [[his]258-milord chantecler country]1038-his country and in confidence [they]1051-their can return to [their]1051-their avocations . Different , indeed , from [that [Monsieur Christopher]190-christopher who , even when [he]190-christopher was still [a soldier]1055-a soldier , more than anything resembled a full , grey , coarse meal - sack short in the wind and with rolling , hard - blue eyes]1054-that monsieur christopher who , even when he was still a soldier , more than anything resembled a full , grey , coarse meal - sack short in the wind and with rolling , hard - blue eyes . Not hard eyes , but of a hard blue ! And yet , curiously , [he]190-christopher too had some of the spirit of [Chantecler]258-milord chantecler beneath [his]190-christopher rolling shoulders of a farmyard boar . Obviously [you]1056-you could not be [[[your]1056-you brother]741-your brother ’s brother]1058-your brother ’s brother and not have some traces of [the Milor]1059-the milor . . . . [The spleen]1060-the spleen too . But [no one]1061-no one could say that [her]1062-her [Mark]199-mark was not [a proper man]1063-a proper man , [Chic]1064-chic in an eccentric manner , but , oh yes , this . And that was [[his]190-christopher brother]1065-his brother . Naturally [he]190-christopher might try to despoil [her]1062-her . But , on occasion , [he]190-christopher treated [her]1062-her with a pompous courtesy — a parade . On the first time [he]190-christopher had seen [her]1062-her — not so long ago that ; only during that period of the war that had been without measurable time — [he]190-christopher had treated [her]1062-her to heavy but expressive gestures of respect and words of courtesy in an old - fashioned language that [he]190-christopher must have learned at [the Theatre Francais]38-the theatre francais while [they]1070-they still played [Ruy Blar]260-ruy blar . French was a different thing now , that [she]1062-her must acknowledge . Certainly without respect [I]0-i Oh , la la ! Whilst [she]1062-her lay on [her]1062-her bed of death [those young fellows]1073-those young fellows and [[their]1073-those young fellows wives]1074-their wives would be all through [her]1062-her presses and armoires like a pack of wolves . . . . La famille . ’ Well , that was very proper . It showed the appropriate spirit of acquisition . What was [a good mother]1075-a good mother for if not to despoil [[[her]1075-a good mother husband]1076-her husband ’s relatives in the interests of [[their]1070-they joint children]1078-their joint children]1077-her husband ’s relatives in the interests of their joint children ! So [Christopher]249-christopher had been as courteous as [a well - trained meal - sack of the dix - huitiéme . Eighteenth century]1079-a well - trained meal - sack of the dix - huitiéme . eighteenth century . Older still , [périade Moliére]261-périade moliére . When [he]1076-her husband had come into [[her]1062-her room]826-her room that had been dimly lit with a veilleuse — a night — light ; they are so much more economical than shaded electric lights!—he had precisely suggested to [her]1062-her a lumbering character from Moliére as presented at [the Comédie Francaise]39-the comédie francaise ; elaborate of phrase and character but protuberant in odd places . [She]1062-her might in that case have supposed that [he]1076-her husband entertained designs on [[her]1062-her person]1081-her person ; but with [his]1076-her husband eyes sticking out in elaborate considerateness , [he]1076-her husband had only come to break to [her]1062-her the news that [[his]1076-her husband brother]1065-his brother was about to make [an honest woman]1083-an honest woman of [her]1062-her . But [the enterprise]1084-the enterprise had had the full concurrence of [Monsieur the Heir]262-monsieur the heir – Apparent . [The four Cramp children at different stages of growth]1219-the four cramp children at different stages of growth crept out of the empty pig - pound.—Cramp was not going to buy [his]1213-you winter pigs till next fortnightly fair at [Little Kingsworth.—The Elliott Children]274-little kingsworth.—the elliott children , with the milk - can , came at a snail ’s pace down [the green path]1220-the green path from [the farm]1221-the farm ; [Mrs. Elliott]275-mrs. elliott , [an enormous woman with untidy hair]1222-an enormous woman with untidy hair , peered over [her]275-mrs. elliott own hedge , which formed [a little enclosure on [the Common]901-the common]1223-a little enclosure on the common ; [Young Hogben]276-young hogben , [[the farmer]1225-the farmer ’s son]1226-the farmer ’s son , [a man of forty]1227-a man of forty , very thick - set , appeared on the path in the beech — wood , ostensibly driving a great black sow . [Even Gunning]198-gunning left [his]198-gunning brushing and lumbered to the edge of [the stable]546-the stable . [Fat ass]1528-fat ass . Chapter 4

[MARK TIETJENS]199-mark thought that a cow or a hog must have got into [the orchard]609-the orchard , there was such a rushing in the grass . [He]199-mark said to [himself]199-mark that [that damn Gunning]1530-that damn gunning was always boasting about [his]199-mark prowess as [a hedger]1531-a hedger ; [he]199-mark might see that [his]199-mark confounded hedges kept out the beasts from [the Common]901-the common . An unusual voice — unusual in its intonation — remarked : “ Oh , [Sir Mark Tietjens]199-mark , this is dreadful ! ” It appeared to be dreadful . [A lady in a long skirt]1533-a lady in a long skirt — [an apparently elderly Di Vernon]1534-an apparently elderly di vernon out of “ [Waverley]64-waverley , ” which was one of the few novels [Mark]199-mark had ever read — was making dreadful havoc with the standing grass . The beautiful , proud heads swayed and went down as [she]1533-a lady in a long skirt rushed knee — deep amongst it ; stopped , rushed again across [his]199-mark view and then stopped apparently to wring [her]1533-a lady in a long skirt hands and once more explain that it was dreadful . A tiny rabbit , scared out by [her]1533-a lady in a long skirt approach , scuttered out under [his]199-mark bed and presumably down into the vegetable beds . [Marie Léonie]209-marie léonie ’s [Mistigris]65-mistigris would probably get it and , since it was [Friday]315-friday , [Marie Léonie]209-marie léonie would be perturbed . [The lady]1366-the lady pushed through the remaining tall grass that stood between [them]1536-them and had the air of rising up at [his]199-mark bed — foot . [She]1366-the lady was rather a faint figure — like the hedge - sparrow . In grey , with a grey short coat and a waistcoat with small round buttons and a three - cornered hat . A tired , thin face . . . . Well , [she]1366-the lady must be tired , pushing through that long grass with a long skirt . [She]1366-the lady had a switch of green shagreen . [The hen - tomtit that lived in the old shoe [they]1536-them had tucked on purpose under [his]199-mark thatch]1537-the hen - tomtit that lived in the old shoe they had tucked on purpose under his thatch uttered long warning cries . [The hen - tomtit]1538-the hen - tomtit did not like the aspect of [this apparition]1539-this apparition . [She]1533-a lady in a long skirt was devouring [his]199-mark face with [her]1533-a lady in a long skirt not disagreeable eyes and muttering : “ Dreadful ! Dreadful ! ” [An aeroplane]817-an aeroplane was passing close overhead . [She]1533-a lady in a long skirt looked up and remarked almost tearfully : “ Has n’t it struck [you]199-mark that but for the sins of [your]199-mark youth [you]199-mark might be doing stunts round [these good - looking hills]1541-these good - looking hills ? Now [I]0-i — ” [Mark]199-mark considered the matter , fixedly returning [her]1533-a lady in a long skirt glance . For [an Englishman]1414-an englishman the phrase , “ the sins of [your]1414-an englishman youth , ” as applied to [a gentleman]1543-a gentleman ’s physical immobility implies only one thing . It never had occurred to [him]199-mark that that implication might be tacked on to [him]199-mark . But of course it might . It was an implication of a disagreeable , or at least a discrediting , kind , because in [his]199-mark class [they]1544-they had been accustomed to consider that the disability was incurred by consorting with [public women of a cheap kind]1545-public women of a cheap kind . [He]199-mark had never consorted with any .woman in [his]199-mark life but [Marie Léonie]209-marie léonie , who was health exaggerated . [A gentleman]1543-a gentleman owes that to [[his]1543-a gentleman fellows]1548-his fellows ! Not [a bad sort of woman]1591-a bad sort of woman : [she]1366-the lady would naturally be irritated at [his]199-mark not answering [her]1366-the lady . It was proper enough . [He]199-mark never remembered to have spoken to [an American]1592-an american or to have thought about [America]72-america . Except , of course , during the war . Then [he]199-mark had spoken to Americans in uniform about Transport . [He]199-mark had n’t liked [their]1593-their collars , but [they]1593-their had known [their]1593-their jobs as far as [their]1593-their jobs went — which had been asking to be provided with a disproportionate amount of transport for [too few troops]1594-too few troops . [He]199-mark had had to wring [that transport]1595-that transport out of [the country]1025-the country . If [he]199-mark had had [his]199-mark way [he]199-mark would n’t have . But [he]199-mark had n’t had [his]199-mark way . Because [the Governing Classes]1597-the governing classes were no good . But [those fellows]1599-those fellows had starved the army of [transport]1600-transport ; then flooded it with so much it could n’t move ; then starved it again . [He]199-mark had never spoken much with any but [men]758-men - and then mostly with [men of [his]199-mark own class]1779-men of his own class and type . If [she]1784-a young or old woman who knew anything about horses knew nothing about horses [you]1780-you talked about the roses or the irises , or the weather last week . But that pretty well exhausted it . Nevertheless , [he]199-mark knew all about [women]759-women . Of that [he]199-mark was confident . That is to say , that when in the course of conversation or gossip [he]199-mark had heard the actions of [women]759-women narrated or commented on , [he]199-mark had always been able to supply a motive for those actions sufficient to account for them to [his]199-mark satisfaction , or to let [him]199-mark predict with accuracy what course the future would take . No doubt , twenty years of listening to the almost ceaseless but never disagreeable conversation of [Marie Léonie]209-marie léonie had been a liberal education . But there probably ought to be a limit to things . [You]1983-you probably ought in this , as in all other things , to know what [you]1983-you can do and what [you]1983-you can’t — and the proof of this particular pudding , as of all others , was in the eating . [Sylvia]289-sylvia had left no stone unturned in the determination to keep [herself]289-sylvia in [[her]289-sylvia man]882-her man ’s mind , and [she]289-sylvia had certainly irretrievably lost [[her]289-sylvia man]882-her man : to [another girl]1987-another girl . Then [she]289-sylvia was just [a nuisance]1988-a nuisance . [A woman intent on getting [a man]757-a man back]1989-a woman intent on getting a man back ought to have some system , some sort of scheme at the very least . But [Sylvia]289-sylvia — [he]882-her man knew it from the interminable talk that [he]882-her man had had with [Christopher]249-christopher on Armistice Night — [Sylvia]289-sylvia delighted most in doing what [she]289-sylvia called pulling the strings of shower - baths . [She]289-sylvia did extravagant things , mostly of a cruel kind , for the fun of seeing what would happen . Well , [you]1983-you can not allow [yourself]1983-you fun when [you]1983-you are on a campaign . Not as to the subject matter of the campaign itself ! If then [you]1983-you do what [you]1983-you want rather than what is expedient , [you]1983-you damn well have to take what [you]1983-you get for it . Damn well ! What would have justified [Sylvia]289-sylvia , no matter what [she]289-sylvia did , would have been if [she]289-sylvia had succeeded in having [another child]1991-another child by [[his]882-her man brother]1065-his brother . [She]289-sylvia had n’t . The breed of [Tietjens]289-sylvia was not enriched . Then [she]289-sylvia was just [a nuisance]1988-a nuisance . . . . An infernal nuisance . . . . For what was [she]289-sylvia up to now ? It was perfectly obvious that both [Mrs. de Bray Pape]284-mrs. de bray pape and [this boy]1774-this boy were here because [she]284-mrs. de bray pape had had another outbreak of . . . practically Sadism . [They]1995-they were here so that [Christopher]249-christopher might be hurt some more and [she]289-sylvia not forgotten . What , then , was it ? What the deuce was it ? [The boy]1269-the boy had been silent for some time . [He]1269-the boy was presumably in a great state ! ’ [He]1269-the boy was undoubtedly like [[his]1269-the boy father]670-his father . Darker . . . [Groby Great Tree]217-groby was the symbol of [Tietjens]199-mark . For thirty miles round [Groby]217-groby [they]2025-they made [their]2025-they marriage vows by [Groby Great Tree]217-groby . In [the other Ridings]2026-the other ridings [they]2025-they said that [Groby Tree]217-groby and [Groby]217-groby well were equal in height and depth one to the other . A foot for every day of the year . . . . [Mark]352-mark swore painfully to [himself]352-mark . [He]352-mark hated to be reminded of that day . BUT no . . . that must have been about twelve , or earlier or later , on that infernal day . In any case [he]352-mark could not remember any subsequent meal [he]352-mark had had then ; but [he]352-mark remembered an almost infinitely long period of intense vexation . Of mortification in so far as [he]352-mark could accuse [himself]352-mark of ever having felt mortified . [He]352-mark could still remember the fierce intaking of [his]352-mark breath through [his]352-mark nostrils that had come when [Christopher]249-christopher had announced what had seemed to [him]352-mark then [his]352-mark ruinous intentions . . . . It had not been till probably four in the morning that [Lord Wolstonmark]354-lord wolstonmark had rung [him]352-mark , [Mark]352-mark , up to ask [him]352-mark to countermand [the transport]2059-the transport that was to have gone out from [Harwich]92-harwich . . . . At four in the morning , [the idiotic brutes.—His substitute]2060-the idiotic brutes.—his substitute had disappeared in the rejoicings , and [Lord Wolstonmark]354-lord wolstonmark had wanted to know what code [they]2061-they used for [Harwich]92-harwich because [the transport]2059-the transport must at all costs be stopped . There was going to be no advance into [Germany]93-germany . . . . [He]352-mark had never spoken after that ! [[His]352-mark brother]1065-his brother was done for ; [the country]1025-the country finished ; [he]352-mark was as good as down and out , as the phrase was , [himself]352-mark . In [his]352-mark deep mortification — yes , mortification!—he had said to [Christopher]249-christopher that morning — the nth November , I9I8 — that [he]352-mark would never speak to [him]352-mark again . [He]352-mark had n’t at that moment meant to say that [he]352-mark would never speak to [Christopher]249-christopher at all again — merely that [he]352-mark was never going to speak to [him]352-mark about affairs — the affairs of [Groby]217-groby ! [Christopher]249-christopher might take [that immense , far - spreading , grey bothersome house]2065-that immense , far - spreading , grey bothersome house and the tree and [the well]2066-the well and [the moors]1652-the moors and all the John Peel outfit . Or [he]352-mark might leave [them]2068-them . [He]2069-he , [Mark]352-mark , was never going to speak about the matter any more . [He]2069-he remembered thinking that [Christopher]249-christopher might have taken [him]2069-he to mean that [he]2069-he intended to with - draw , for what it was worth , the light of [his]2069-he countenance from the [Christopher Tietjens]249-christopher manage . Well , [he]2069-he had n’t gone back on that ! But once the idea of retiring , not only from [the Office]994-the office but [the whole world]2081-the whole world , had come into [his]2069-he head it had grown and grown , on top of [his]2069-he mortification and [his]2069-he weariness . Because [he]2069-he could not conceal from [himself]2069-he that [he]2069-he was weary to death — of [the Office]994-the office , of [the nation]594-the nation , of [the world]522-the world and [people]1333-people . . . . [He]2069-he had done [his]2069-he job.—That was before [Wolstonmark]354-lord wolstonmark had telephoned , and [he]2069-he still thought that [he]2069-he had done [his]2069-he job of getting things here and there about [the world]522-the world to some purpose . [Chiefly Christopher]355-christopher . But that reacted on [the tenantry]2096-the tenantry . [He]2069-he had always been tired of [the tenantry]2096-the tenantry and [Groby]286-groby . [He]2069-he had been born tired of [them]2096-the tenantry . That happens . It happens particularly in [old and prominent families]2098-old and prominent families . It was odd that [Groby]286-groby and the whole Groby business should so bore [him]2069-he ; [he]2069-he supposed [he]2069-he had been born with [some kink]2099-some kink . [The Hapsburgs]356-the hapsburgs were said to hate [[their]356-the hapsburgs palaces]2107-their palaces — that was no doubt why [so many of [them]356-the hapsburgs]2108-so many of them , beginning with [Juan Ort]357-juan ort , had come muckers . And at a very early age [he]2069-he had decided that [he]2069-he would chuck [the country]1025-the country — gentleman business . [He]2069-he did n’t see that [he]2069-he was the one to bother with [those confounded , hard — headed beggars]2110-those confounded , hard — headed beggars or with those confounded wind - swept moors and wet [valley bottoms]2111-valley bottoms . It had been mostly swank that , always ; since the Corn Laws , it had been almost entirely swank . Well , [he]2069-he had never intended to do it , because [he]2069-he had been born tired of it . That would have been quite satisfactory . [Ted]332-teddy hope , [[his]2069-he next brother]2128-his next brother , had had [his]332-teddy hope head screwed on all right . Until [[his]352-mark father]670-his father ’s death [Mark]352-mark had bothered precious little about [the fellow]1767-the fellow . So [he]352-mark had hardly seen [the boy]1269-the boy . And at [Christopher]355-christopher ’s wedding [he]352-mark had definitely decided that [he]352-mark would not see [him]1269-the boy again — a mug who had got trepanned into marrying [a whore]1127-a whore . [He]352-mark wished [[his]352-mark brother]1065-his brother no ill , but the thought of [him]1065-his brother made [Mark]352-mark sickish . And then , for years , [he]352-mark had heard the worst possible rumours about [Christopher]355-christopher . In a way [they]2152-they had rather consoled [Mark]352-mark . God knows , [he]352-mark cared little enough about [the Tietjens family]1788-the tietjens family — particularly for [the children by that soft saint]2154-the children by that soft saint . But [he]352-mark would rather have [any brother of]2155-any brother of [his]352-mark be [a wrong un]2156-a wrong un than [a mug]2157-a mug . Then gradually , from the gossip that went abroad , [he]352-mark had come to think that [Christopher]355-christopher was [a very bad wrong un]2158-a very bad wrong un indeed . [He]352-mark could account for it easily enough . [Christopher]355-christopher had a soft streak , and what [a woman]1049-a woman can do to deteriorate [a fellow with a soft streak]2160-a fellow with a soft streak is beyond belief . And [the woman [Christopher]355-christopher had got hold of — who had got hold of [him]355-christopher]2161-the woman christopher had got hold of — who had got hold of him — passed belief too . [Mark]352-mark did not hold any great opinion of [women]759-women at all ; if [they]759-women were a little plump , healthy , at little loyal and not noticeable in [their]759-women dress that was enough for [him]355-christopher . . . . But [Sylvia]289-sylvia was as thin as an eel , as full of vice as a mare that ’s [a wrong un , completely disloyal and dressed like any Paris cocotte]2163-a wrong un , completely disloyal and dressed like any paris cocotte . [Christopher]355-christopher , as [he]355-christopher saw it , had had to keep [that harlot]2164-that harlot to the tune of six or seven thousand a year , in [a society of all wrong uns]2165-a society of all wrong uns too — and on an income of at most two . . . . Plenty for [a younger son]2166-a younger son . But naturally [he]355-christopher had had to go wrong to get the money . So it had seemed to [him]355-christopher . . . and it had seemed to matter precious little . [He]355-christopher gave a thought to [[his]355-christopher brother]1065-his brother perhaps twice a year . But then one day — just after [the two brothers]2168-the two brothers had been killed — [[their]2168-the two brothers father]2169-their father had come up from [Groby]217-groby to say to [Mark]352-mark at [the Club]1716-the club : “ Has it occurred to [you]352-mark that , since [those two boys]2171-those two boys are killed , that fellow [Christopher]355-christopher is practically [heir to [Groby]217-groby]2172-heir to groby ? [You]352-mark have [no legitimate children]2173-no legitimate children , have [you]352-mark [i]0-i ” [Mark]352-mark replied that [he]352-mark had n’t [any bastards]2174-any bastards either , and that [he]352-mark was certainly not ‘ going to marry . So [Christopher]355-christopher — or at any rate [[Christopher]355-christopher ’s heir]2176-christopher ’s heir — must surely come in to [Groby]217-groby . It had not really , hitherto , occurred to [him]355-christopher . But when it was thus put forcibly into [his]355-christopher mind [he]355-christopher saw instantly that it upset the whole scheme of [his]355-christopher life . As [he]355-christopher saw [Christopher]355-christopher then , [the fellow]1767-the fellow was [the last person in [the world]522-the world]2178-the last person in the world to have the charge of [Groby]217-groby — for [you]2180-you had to regard that as to some extent a cure of souls . And [he]355-christopher , [himself]355-christopher , would not be much better . [He]355-christopher was hopelessly out of touch with [the estate]2127-the estate , and , even though [[[his]355-christopher father]670-his father ’s land - steward]2183-his father ’s land - steward was [a quite efficient fellow]2184-a quite efficient fellow , [he]355-christopher [himself]355-christopher at that date was so hopelessly immersed in the affairs of the then war that [he]355-christopher would hardly have a moment of time to learn anything about the property . There Was , therefore , a breakdown in [his]355-christopher scheme of life . That was already a pretty shaking sort of affair . [Mark]352-mark was accustomed to regard [himself]352-mark as master of [his]352-mark fate — as being so limited in [his]352-mark ambitions and so entrenched behind [his]352-mark habits and [his]352-mark wealth that , if circumstances need not of necessity bend to [his]352-mark will , fate could hardly touch [him]352-mark . And it was one thing for [a Tietjens younger son]2185-a tietjens younger son to be [a bold sort of law - breaker]2186-a bold sort of law - breaker — or at any rate that [he]355-christopher should be contemptuous of restraint . But — infinitely worse - it had made [Christopher]355-christopher absolutely determined not to accept a single penny of the money that had become [Mark]352-mark ’s and that had been [[his]352-mark father]670-his father ’s . And [Christopher]355-christopher was as obstinate as a hog . For that [Mark]352-mark did not blame [him]355-christopher . It was a [Tietjens]289-sylvia job to be as obstinate as a hog . So that [his]355-christopher refusal to take on that stewardship might very well arise from a sort of craving for mortification of the spirit . [They]2260-englishmen had not used to . Now , no doubt , [they]2260-englishmen did . It was a Russian sort of trick . [He]355-christopher was just lazy and determined — and done with it ! [He]352-mark had , nevertheless , felt a warm admiration for [[his]352-mark brother]1065-his brother the moment the words had been said . A proper Yorkshire sentiment , uttered coldly and , as it were , good - humouredly . [His]352-mark eyes , naturally , had goggled , but [he]352-mark had displayed no other emotion . [He]352-mark had practically beggared [the wretched fellow , who , counting on living on [his]2299-the wretched fellow , who , counting on living on his pay for at least a year longer , had mortgaged his blood - money in order to go into a sort of partnership in an old - furniture business with a confounded american pay for at least a year longer , had mortgaged [his]2299-the wretched fellow , who , counting on living on his pay for at least a year longer , had mortgaged his blood - money in order to go into a sort of partnership in an old - furniture business with a confounded american blood - money in order to go into a sort of partnership in an old - furniture business with [a confounded American]2300-a confounded american]2299-the wretched fellow , who , counting on living on his pay for at least a year longer , had mortgaged his blood - money in order to go into a sort of partnership in an old - furniture business with a confounded american . There [he]355-christopher had been , just before Armistice Day , upon the point of demobilization and without an available penny ! [They]2305-they had at once started arguing — or , rather , [each]2306-each had started exposing [his]355-christopher views . [Christopher]355-christopher stated what [he]355-christopher was going to do , and [Mark]352-mark [his]352-mark horror at what [Christopher]355-christopher proposed . [Mark]352-mark ’s horror came from the fact that [Christopher]355-christopher proposed to eschew comfort . [An Englishmen]2307-an englishmen ’s duty is to secure for [himself]355-christopher for ever reasonable clothing , a clean shirt a day , a couple of mutton chops grilled without condiments , two floury potatoes , an apple pie with a piece of Stilton and pulled bread , a pint of Club Médoc , [a clean room]2308-a clean room , in the winter a good fire in the grate , a comfortable arm - chair , [a comfortable woman]2309-a comfortable woman to see that all these were prepared for [you]2310-you , to keep [you]2310-you warm in bed and to brush [your]2310-you bowler and fold [your]2310-you umbrella in the morning . When [you]2310-you had that secure for life , [you]2310-you could do what [you]2310-you liked provided that what [you]2310-you did never endangered that security . What was to be said against that ? [Christopher]355-christopher had nothing to advance except that [he]355-christopher was not going to live in that way . [He]355-christopher was not going to live in that way unless [he]355-christopher could secure that , or something like it , by [his]355-christopher own talents . [His]355-christopher only available and at the same time marketable talent was [his]355-christopher gift for knowing genuine old furniture . So [he]355-christopher was going to make a living out of old furniture . [He]355-christopher had had [his]355-christopher scheme perfectly matured ; [he]355-christopher had even secured [an American partner]2311-an american partner , [a fellow who had as great a gift for the cajolement of [American purchasers of old stuff]2313-american purchasers of old stuff]2312-a fellow who had as great a gift for the cajolement of american purchasers of old stuff as [he]355-christopher , [Christopher]355-christopher , had for its discovery . At that [you]2317-you could make a living . Other careers , [he]355-christopher said , were barred to [him]355-christopher . [The Department of Statistics , in which [he]355-christopher had formerly had a post]2318-the department of statistics , in which he had formerly had a post , had absolutely cold - shouldered [him]355-christopher . [They]2315-they were not only adamant , [they]2315-they were also vindictive against [civil servants who had become [serving soldiers]2320-serving soldiers]2319-civil servants who had become serving soldiers . [Women]759-women had naturally preferred [soldiers]655-soldiers to [civilians]2327-civilians ; [the civilians]2328-the civilians were now getting back on [them]759-women . That was natural . [Mark]352-mark agreed that it was natural . [He]352-mark agreed , too , that [Christopher]355-christopher could not go back to [the Department]2332-the department . There [he]355-christopher was certainly [a marked man]2333-a marked man . [He]355-christopher could possibly have insisted on [his]355-christopher rights to be taken back even though [his]355-christopher lungs , being by now pretty damaged by exposure , might afford [them]2334-them a pretext for legally refusing [him]355-christopher . H.M. [Civil Service and Departments]2335-civil service and departments have the right to refuse employment to [persons likely to become unfit for good]2336-persons likely to become unfit for good . [A man who has lost an eye]2337-a man who has lost an eye may be refused by [any Department]2338-any department because [he]2337-a man who has lost an eye may lose the other and so become liable for a pension . But , even if [Christopher]355-christopher forced [himself]355-christopher on [the Department]2332-the department , [they]2334-them would have [their]2334-them bad mark against [him]355-christopher . [He]355-christopher had been too rude to [them]2334-them during the war when [they]2334-them had tried to force [him]355-christopher to employ [himself]355-christopher in the faking of statistics that [the Ministry]798-the ministry had coerced [the Department]96-the department into supplying in order to dish the French , who demanded [more troops]2341-more troops . With that point of view , [Mark]352-mark found [himself]352-mark entirely in sympathy . [His]352-mark long association with [Marie Léonie]360-marie léonie , [his]352-mark respect for the way in which [she]360-marie léonie had [her]360-marie léonie head screwed on , the constant intimacy with the life and point of view of [French individuals of the petite bourgeoisie which [her]360-marie léonie gossip]2342-french individuals of the petite bourgeoisie which her gossip had given [him]352-mark — all these things , together with [his]352-mark despair for the future of [[his]352-mark own country]2343-his own country , had given [him]352-mark a very considerable belief in the destinies and , indeed , in the virtues of [[the country]1025-the country across [the Channel]97-the channel]2345-the country across the channel . It would , therefore , have been very distasteful to [him]352-mark that [[his]352-mark brother]1065-his brother should take pay from [an organization that had been employed to deal treacherously with [[our]2348-we Allies]2349-our allies]2347-an organization that had been employed to deal treacherously with our allies . It had , indeed , become extremely distasteful to [him]352-mark to take pay [himself]352-mark from [a Government that had forced such a course upon [the nation]594-the nation]2350-a government that had forced such a course upon the nation , and [he]352-mark would thankfully have resigned from [[his]352-mark Office]985-his office if [he]352-mark had not considered that [his]352-mark services were indispensable to the successful prosecution of the war which was then still proceeding . [He]352-mark wanted to be done with it , but , at the moment , [he]352-mark saw no chance . The war was by then obviously proceeding towards a successful issue . Owing to the military genius of the French , who , by [then , had the supreme command]2353-then , had the supreme command , [the enemy nations]2354-the enemy nations were daily being forced to abandon [great stretches of territory]2355-great stretches of territory . But that only made the calls on Transport the greater , whilst , if [we]2348-we were successfully and unwastefully to occupy [the enemy capital]2356-the enemy capital , as at that date [he]352-mark imagined that [we]2348-we obviously must , the demand for the provision of Transport must become almost unmeasurable . Still , that was no argument for the reentry of [[his]352-mark brother]1065-his brother into the service of [the country]1025-the country . As [he]352-mark saw things , public life had become — and must remain for a long period — so demoralized by [the members of [the then Government]2360-the then government]2359-the members of the then government , with [their]2359-the members of the then government devious foreign policies and [their]2359-the members of the then government intimacies with a class of [shady financiers such as]2361-shady financiers such as had never hitherto had any finger in the English political pie — public life had become so discreditable an affair that the only remedy was for [the real governing classes]2362-the real governing classes to retire altogether from public pursuits . Things , in short , must become worse before they could grow better . With the dreadful condition of ruin at [home]649-home and foreign discredit to which [the country]1025-the country must almost immediately emerge under the conduct of [the Scotch grocers]2365-the scotch grocers , [Frankfort financiers]2366-frankfort financiers , [Welsh pettifoggers]2367-welsh pettifoggers , [Midland armament manufacturers]2368-midland armament manufacturers and [South Country incompetents who during the later years of the war had intrigued [themselves]2369-south country incompetents who during the later years of the war had intrigued themselves into office into office]2369-south country incompetents who during the later years of the war had intrigued themselves into office — with that dreadful condition staring it in the face , [the country]1025-the country must return to something like [its]1025-the country old standards of [North Country]2371-north country common sense and English probity . [The old governing class to which [he]352-mark and [[his]352-mark belonged]2373-his belonged]2372-the old governing class to which he and his belonged might never return to power , but , whatever revolutions took place — and [he]352-mark did not care [I]0-i — [the country]1025-the country must reawaken to the necessity for exacting of whoever might be [its governing class]2375-its governing class some semblance of personal probity and public honouring of pledges . [He]352-mark obviously was out of it , or [he]352-mark would be out of it with the end of the war , for even from [his]352-mark bed [he]352-mark had taken no small part in the directing of affairs at [[his]352-mark Office]985-his office . . . . A state of war obviously favoured the coming to the top of all kinds of [devious stormy petrels]2377-devious stormy petrels ; that was inevitable and could not be helped . But in normal times [a country]2378-a country — [every country]2379-every country — was true to [itself]2379-every country . Nevertheless , [he]352-mark was very content that [[his]352-mark brother]1065-his brother should , in the interim , have no share in affairs . Let [him]352-mark secure [his]352-mark mutton chop , [his]352-mark pint of claret , [[his]352-mark woman]634-his woman and [his]352-mark umbrella , and it mattered not into what obscurity [he]352-mark retired . But how was that to be secured ? There had seemed to be several ways . [He]352-mark was aware , for instance , that [Christopher]355-christopher was both [a mathematician of no mean order]2382-a mathematician of no mean order and [a Churchman]2383-a churchman . [He]355-christopher might perfectly well take orders , assume the charge of one of the three family livings that [Mark]352-mark had in [his]352-mark gift , and , whilst competently discharging the duties of [his]352-mark cure , pursue whatever are the occupations of [a well - cared - for mathematician]2384-a well - cared - for mathematician . [Christopher]355-christopher , however , whilst avowing [his]355-christopher predilection for such a life — which , as [Mark]352-mark saw it , was exactly fitted to [his]355-christopher asceticism , [his]355-christopher softness in general and [his]355-christopher private tastes — [Christopher]355-christopher admitted that there was an obstacle to [his]355-christopher assuming such a cure of souls — an obstacle of an insuperable nature . [Mark]352-mark at once asked [him]355-christopher if [he]355-christopher were , in fact , living with [Miss Wannop]364-miss wannop . But [Christopher]355-christopher answered that [he]355-christopher had not seen [Miss Wannop]364-miss wannop since the day of [his]355-christopher second proceeding to the front . [They]2385-they had then agreed that [they]2385-they were not [the sort of persons to begin a hidden intrigue]2386-the sort of persons to begin a hidden intrigue , and the affair had proceeded no further . [Mark]352-mark was , however , aware that [a person of [Christopher]355-christopher]2387-a person of christopher ’s way of thinking might well feel inhibited from taking on a cure of souls if , in spite of the fact that [he]355-christopher had abstained from seducing [a young woman]713-a young woman , [he]355-christopher nevertheless privately desired to enter into illicit relations with [her]713-a young woman , and that that was sufficient to justify [him]355-christopher in saying that an insuperable obstacle existed . [He]355-christopher did not know that [he]355-christopher [himself]355-christopher agreed , but it was not [his]355-christopher business to interfere between [any man]1940-any man and [his]355-christopher conscience in a matter of [the Church]98-the church . [He]355-christopher was [himself]355-christopher [no very good Christian]2390-no very good christian , at any rate as regards the relationships of [men]758-men and [women]759-women . Nevertheless , [the Church of [England]15-england]99-the church of england was [the Church of [England]15-england]2393-the church of england . No doubt , had [Christopher]355-christopher been [a Papist]2394-a papist [he]355-christopher could have had [the young woman]880-the young woman for [[his]355-christopher housekeeper]2396-his housekeeper and [no one]1061-no one would have bothered . But what the devil , then , was [[his]355-christopher brother]1065-his brother to do P [He]1065-his brother had been offered , as [a sop in the pan]2399-a sop in the pan , and to keep [him]355-christopher quiet , no doubt , over the affair of [the Department of Statistics]2400-the department of statistics , [a vice - consulate in [some Mediterranean poi - t — Toulon]2402-some mediterranean poi - t — toulon or Leghorn]2401-a vice - consulate in some mediterranean poi - t — toulon or leghorn , or [some - thing of the sort]2403-some - thing of the sort . That might have done well enough . It was absurd to think of [a Tietjens]2404-a tietjens , heir to [Groby]217-groby , being under the necessity of making a living . It was fantastic , but if [Christopher]355-christopher was in a fantastic mood there was nothing to be done about it . [A vice - consulate]2405-a vice - consulate is a potty sort of job . [You]2406-you attend to [ships]2407-ships ’ manifests , get [members of [crews]2409-crews]2408-members of crews out of [jail]2410-jail , give [old lady tourists]2411-old lady tourists the addresses of [boarding - houses kept by [English or half — castes]2413-english or half — castes]2412-boarding - houses kept by english or half — castes , or provide [the vice - admirals of [visiting British squadrons]2415-visiting british squadrons]2414-the vice - admirals of visiting british squadrons with the names of [local residents who should be invited to entertainments given on]2416-local residents who should be invited to entertainments given on [the flagship]2417-the flagship . It was a potty job ; innocuous too , if it could be regarded as a sort of marking time . . . . And at that moment [Mark]352-mark thought that [Christopher]355-christopher was still holding out for some sort of concession on [Mark]352-mark ’s part before definitely assuming the charge of [Groby]217-groby , [its tenants]2418-its tenants and its mineral rights . . . . But there were insuperable objections to even [the vice — consulate]2419-the vice — consulate . In the first place , the job would have been in the public service , a fact to which , as has been said , [Mark]352-mark strongly objected . Then the job was offered as a sort of a bribe . And , in addition , [the consular service]2420-the consular service exacts from every one who occupies a consular or vice — consular post the deposit of a sum of four hundred pounds sterling , and [Christopher]355-christopher did not possess even so much as four hundred shillings . . . . And , in addition , as [Mark]352-mark was well aware , [Miss Wannop]364-miss wannop might again afford an obstacle . [A British vice - consul]2421-a british vice - consul might possibly keep [a Maltese or Levantine]2422-a maltese or levantine in [a back street]2423-a back street and no harm done , but [he]2421-a british vice - consul probably could not live with [an English young woman of family and position]2424-an english young woman of family and position without causing so much scandal as to make [him]2421-a british vice - consul lose [his]2421-a british vice - consul job . . . . It was at this point that [Mark]352-mark again , but for the last time , asked [[his]352-mark brother]1065-his brother why [he]1065-his brother did not divorce [Sylvia]289-sylvia . By that time [Marie Léonie]360-marie léonie had retired to get some rest . [She]360-marie léonie was pretty worn out . [Mark]352-mark ’s illness had been long and serious ; [she]360-marie léonie had nursed [him]352-mark with such care that during the whole time [she]360-marie léonie had not been out into [the streets]2087-the streets except once or twice to go across [the road]588-the road to [the Catholic church]2428-the catholic church , where [she]360-marie léonie would offer a candle or so for [his]352-mark recovery , and once or twice to remonstrate with [the butcher]2429-the butcher as to the quality of the meat [he]352-mark supplied for [Mark]352-mark ’s broths . In addition , on many days , [she]360-marie léonie had worked late , under [Mark’s]365-mark’s — directions , on papers that [the Office]994-the office had sent [him]352-mark . [She]360-marie léonie either could not or would not put [[her]360-marie léonie man]882-her man into the charge of [any kind of night nurse]2432-any kind of night nurse . [She]360-marie léonie alleged that the war had mopped up every kind of available attendant on [the sick]2433-the sick , but [Mark]352-mark shrewdly suspected that [she]360-marie léonie had made no kind of effort to secure [an assistant]2434-an assistant . There was [her]360-marie léonie national dread of draughts to account for that . [She]360-marie léonie accepted with discipline , if with despair , [the English doctor]2435-the english doctor ’s dictum that fresh air must be admitted to [the sick — room]2436-the sick — room , but [she]360-marie léonie sat up night after night in a hooded chair , watching for any change in the wind and moving in accordance a complicated arrangement of screens that [she]360-marie léonie maintained between [[her]360-marie léonie patient]2437-her patient and the open window . [She]360-marie léonie had , however , surrendered [Mark]352-mark to [[his]352-mark brother]1065-his brother without a murmur , and had quietly gone to [[her]360-marie léonie own room]2439-her own room to sleep , and [Mark]352-mark , though [he]352-mark carried on almost every kind of conversation with [[his]352-mark brother]1065-his brother , and though [he]352-mark would not have asked [her]360-marie léonie to leave [them]2441-them in order that [he]352-mark might engage on topics that [[his]352-mark brother]1065-his brother might like to regard as private — [Mark]352-mark seized the opportunity to lay before [Christopher]355-christopher what [he]352-mark thought of [Sylvia]289-sylvia and the relationships of [that singular couple]2443-that singular couple . It amounted , in the end , to the fact that [Mark]352-mark wanted [Christopher]355-christopher to divorce [[his]355-christopher wife]2194-his wife , and to the fact that [Christopher]355-christopher had not altered in [his]355-christopher views that [a man]757-a man can not divorce [a woman]1049-a woman . [Mark]352-mark put it that if [Christopher]355-christopher intended to take up with [Valentine]191-valentine , it mattered practically very little whether after an attempt at a divorce [he]355-christopher married [her]191-valentine or not . What [a man]757-a man has to do if [he]757-a man means to take up with [a woman]1049-a woman , and as far as possible to honour [her]1049-a woman , is to make some sort of fight of it — as a symbol . Marriage , if [you]2449-you do not regard it as a sacrament — as , no doubt , it ought to be regarded — was nothing more than a token that [a couple]2450-a couple intended to stick to [each other]791-each other . [Nowadays people]2452-nowadays people — [the right people]2453-the right people — bothered precious little about anything but that . A constant change of [partners]2454-partners was a social nuisance ; [you]2449-you could not tell whether [you]2449-you could or could n’t invite [a couple]2450-a couple together to a tea — fight . And society existed for social functions . That was why promiscuity was no good . For social functions [you]2449-you had to have an equal number of [men]758-men and [women]759-women , or [someone]2458-someone got left out of conversations , and so [you]2449-you had to know who , officially in the social sense , went with whom . [Everyone]2459-everyone knew that [all the children of [Lupus at the War Office]2461-lupus at the war office]2460-all the children of lupus at the war office were really [the children of [a Prime Minister]2463-a prime minister]2462-the children of a prime minister , so that presumably [the Countess]1260-the countess and [the Prime Minister]1460-the prime minister slept together most of the time , but that did not mean that [you]2449-you invited [the Prime Minister]1460-the prime minister and [the woman]1982-the woman to social — official functions , because [they]2468-they had n’t any ostensible token of union . On the contrary , [you]2449-you invited [Lord]2469-lord and [Lady Lupus]366-lady lupus together to all functions that would get into the papers , but [you]2449-you took care to have [the Lady]1366-the lady at any private , weekend - ish parties or intimate dinners to which [the Chief]2471-the chief was coming . And [Christopher]355-christopher had to consider that if it came to marriage ninety per cent . of [the inhabitants of [the world]522-the world]2472-the inhabitants of the world regarded the marriages of almost [everybody else]2474-everybody else as invalid . [A Papist]2394-a papist obviously could not regard a marriage before [an English registrar]2476-an english registrar or a French main ’ as having any moral validity . At best it was no more than a demonstration of aspirations after constancy . [You]2449-you went before [a functionary]2477-a functionary publicly to assert that [man]2478-man and [woman]2479-woman intended to stick to [each other]791-each other . Equally for extreme Protestants a marriage by [a Papist priest]2481-a papist priest , or [a minister of any other sect]2482-a minister of any other sect , or [a Buddhist Lama]2483-a buddhist lama , had not the blessing of [[their]2484-their own brand of [Deity]367-deity]2485-their own brand of deity . So that really , to all practical intents , it was sufficient if [a couple]2450-a couple really assured [[their]2450-a couple friends]2487-their friends that [they]2450-a couple intended to stick together , if possible , for ever ; if not , at least for years enough to show that [they]2450-a couple had made a good shot at it . [Mark]352-mark invited [Christopher]355-christopher to consult whom [he]355-christopher liked in [his]352-mark , [Mark]352-mark ’s , particular set and [he]355-christopher would find that [they]2488-they agreed with [his]355-christopher views . So [he]352-mark was anxious that if [Christopher]355-christopher intended to take up with [the Wannop young woman]2489-the wannop young woman [he]355-christopher should take at least a shot at a divorce . [He]355-christopher might not succeed in getting one . [He]355-christopher obviously had grounds enough , but [Sylvia]289-sylvia might make counter - allegations , [he]355-christopher , [Mark]352-mark , could n’t say with what chance of success . [He]355-christopher was prepared [himself]355-christopher to accept [[his]355-christopher brother]1065-his brother ’s assertions of complete innocence , but [Sylvia]289-sylvia was [a clever devil]2491-a clever devil and there was no knowing what view [a judge]2492-a judge might take . Where there had been such a hell of a lot of smoke [he]355-christopher might consider that there must be enough flame to justify refusing a divorce . There would no doubt be , thus — a beastly stink . But a beastly stink would be better than the sort of veiled ill — fame that [Sylvia]289-sylvia had contrived to get attached to [Christopher]355-christopher . And the fact that [Christopher]355-christopher had faced the stink and made the attempt would be at least that amount of tribute to [Miss Wannop]364-miss wannop . [Society]368-society was good - natured and was inclined to take the View that if [a fellow]1603-a fellow had faced [his]355-christopher punishment and taken it [he]355-christopher was pretty well absolved . There might be [people]1333-people who would hold out against [them]2495-them , but [Mark]352-mark supposed that what [Christopher]355-christopher wanted for [himself]355-christopher and [[his]355-christopher girl]2496-his girl was reasonable material comfort with a society of [sufficient people of the right sort]2497-sufficient people of the right sort to give [them]2498-them [a dinner or so a week and a week - end or so a month in the week — ending season]2499-a dinner or so a week and a week - end or so a month in the week — ending season . [Christopher]355-christopher had acquiesced in the justness of [his]355-christopher views with so much amiability that [Mark]352-mark began to hope that [he]355-christopher would get [his]355-christopher way in the larger matter of [Groby]217-groby . [He]352-mark was prepared to go further and to stake as much as [his]352-mark assurance that if [Christopher]355-christopher would settle down at [Groby]217-groby , accept a decent income and look after [the estate]2127-the estate , [he]352-mark , [Mark]352-mark , would assure [[his]352-mark brother]1065-his brother and [Valentine]191-valentine of bearable social circumstances . [Christopher]355-christopher , however , had made no answer at all beyond saying that if [he]355-christopher tried to divorce [Sylvia]289-sylvia it would apparently ruin [his]355-christopher old — furniture business . For [[his]355-christopher American partner]2502-his american partner assured [him]355-christopher that in [the United States]100-the united states if [a man]757-a man divorced [[his]757-a man wife]2194-his wife instead of letting [her]2194-his wife divorce [him]757-a man [no one]1061-no one would do any business with [him]757-a man . [He]355-christopher had mentioned the case of [a man called [Blum]369-blum , [a pretty warm stock — exchange man]2507-a pretty warm stock — exchange man , who insisted on divorcing [[his]369-blum wife]2194-his wife against the advice of [[his]369-blum friends]1813-his friends]2506-a man called blum , a pretty warm stock — exchange man , who insisted on divorcing his wife against the advice of his friends ; [he]369-blum found when [he]369-blum returned to [the stock market]2510-the stock market that all [[his]369-blum clients]2511-his clients cold‘-shouldered [him]369-blum , so that [he]369-blum was ruined . And as [these fellows]1121-these fellows were shortly going to mop up everything in [the world]522-the world , including the old - furniture trade , [Christopher]355-christopher supposed that [he]355-christopher would have to study [their]1121-these fellows prejudices . [He]355-christopher had come across [[his]355-christopher partner]2314-his partner rather curiously . [The fellow]1767-the fellow , whose father had been [a German – Jew]2516-a german – jew but [a naturalized American citizen]2517-a naturalized american citizen , had been in [Berlin]101-berlin mopping up German old furniture for sale in [the American interior]2518-the american interior , where [he]1767-the fellow had a flourishing business . So , when [America]72-america had come in on the side that was not German , [the Germans]230-the germans had just simply dropped on [Mr. Schatzweiler]370-mr. schatzweiler in [their]230-the germans pleasant way , incorporated [him]370-mr. schatzweiler in [[their]230-the germans forces]2519-their forces and had sent [him]370-mr. schatzweiler to the front as [a miserable little Tommy]2520-a miserable little tommy before [the Americans]210-americans had been a month in the show . And there , amongst [the prisoners [he]355-christopher had had to look after]2521-the prisoners he had had to look after , [Christopher]355-christopher had found [the little , large - eyed sensitive creature , unable to speak a word of German but just crazy about the furniture and tapestries in [the French chateaux that [the prisoners]2524-the prisoners passed on [their]2524-the prisoners marches]2523-the french chateaux that the prisoners passed on their marches]2522-the little , large - eyed sensitive creature , unable to speak a word of german but just crazy about the furniture and tapestries in the french chateaux that the prisoners passed on their marches . [Christopher]355-christopher had befriended [him]370-mr. schatzweiler ; kept [him]370-mr. schatzweiler as far as possible separated from [the other prisoners]2525-the other prisoners , who naturally did not like [him]370-mr. schatzweiler , and had a good many conversations with [him]370-mr. schatzweiler . It had appeared that [Mr. Schatzweiler]370-mr. schatzweiler had had a good deal to do in the way of buying with [Sir John Robertson]371-sir john , [the old old - furniture millionaire , who was [a close friend of [Sylvia]289-sylvia ’s]2527-a close friend of sylvia ’s and had been so considerable admirer of [Christopher]355-christopher ’s furniture - buying gifts that [he]371-sir john had , years ago , proposed to take [Christopher]355-christopher into partnership with [himself]371-sir john]2526-the old old - furniture millionaire , who was a close friend of sylvia ’s and had been so considerable admirer of christopher ’s furniture - buying gifts that he had , years ago , proposed to take christopher into partnership with himself . At that time [Christopher]355-christopher had regarded [Sir John]371-sir john ’s proposals as outside the range of [his]355-christopher future ; [he]355-christopher had then been employed in [the Department of Statistics]2400-the department of statistics . But the proposal had always amused and rather impressed [him]355-christopher . If , that is to say , [that hard - headed old Scotsman who had made a vast fortune at [his]2529-that hard - headed old scotsman who had made a vast fortune at his trade trade]2529-that hard - headed old scotsman who had made a vast fortune at his trade made to [Christopher]355-christopher a quite serious business proposition on the strength of [Christopher]355-christopher ’s flair in the matter of old woods and curves , [Christopher]355-christopher [himself]355-christopher might take [his]355-christopher own gifts with a certain seriousness . And by the time [he]355-christopher came to be in command of the escort over those miserable creatures [he]355-christopher had pretty well realized that after the necessity for [escorts]2530-escorts was over [he]355-christopher would jolly well have to consider how [he]355-christopher was going to make a living for [himself]355-christopher . That was certain . [He]355-christopher was not going to reinsert [himself]355-christopher amongst [the miserable collection of squits who occupied [themselves]2531-the miserable collection of squits who occupied themselves in his old department in [[his]355-christopher old Department]2532-his old department]2531-the miserable collection of squits who occupied themselves in his old department ; [he]355-christopher was too old to continue in [the Army]102-the army ; [he]355-christopher was certainly not going to accept a penny from [Groby]217-groby sources . [He]355-christopher did not care what became of [him]355-christopher — but [his]355-christopher not caring did not take any tragico - romantic form . [He]355-christopher would be quite prepared to live in [a hut on [a hillside]2534-a hillside]2533-a hut on a hillside and cook [his]355-christopher meals over three bricks outside the door — but that was not a method of life that was very practicable and even that needed money . [Everyone who served in [the Army at the front]2536-the army at the front]2535-everyone who served in the army at the front knew how little it took to keep life going — and satisfactory . But [he]355-christopher did not see [the world]522-the world , when it settled down again , turning itself into a place fit for [old soldiers who had learned to appreciate frugality]2538-old soldiers who had learned to appreciate frugality . On the contrary , [the old soldiers]2539-the old soldiers would be chivvied to hell by [a civilian population who abhorred [them]2539-the old soldiers]2540-a civilian population who abhorred them . So that merely to keep clean and out of debt was going to be a tough job . So , in [his]355-christopher long vigils in [tents]2541-tents , beneath the moon , with [the sentries]2542-the sentries walking , challenging from time to time , round the barbed wire stockades , the idea of [Sir John]371-sir john ’s proposition had occurred to [him]355-christopher with some force . It had gathered strength from [his]355-christopher meeting with [Mr. Schatzweiler]370-mr. schatzweiler . [The little fellow]2543-the little fellow was [a shivering artist]2544-a shivering artist , and [Christopher]355-christopher had enough of superstition in [him]355-christopher to be impressed by the coincidence of [their]2545-their having come together in such unlikely circumstances . After all , [Providence]343-providence must let up on [him]355-christopher after a time , so why should not [this unfortunate and impressively Oriental member of [the Chosen People]2547-the chosen people]2546-this unfortunate and impressively oriental member of the chosen people be a sign of a covenant ? In a way [he]2543-the little fellow reminded [Christopher]355-christopher of [[his]355-christopher former protégé [Mac - master]2549-mac - master]2548-his former protégé mac - master — [he]2543-the little fellow had the same dark eyes , the same shape , the same shivering eagerness . That [he]2543-the little fellow was [a Jew]2550-a jew and [an American]1592-an american did not worry [Christopher]355-christopher ; [he]355-christopher had not objected to the fact that [Macmaster]372-lady macmaster had been [the son of a Scotch grocer]2552-the son of a scotch grocer . If [he]355-christopher had to go into partnership and be thrown into close contact with [anyone at all]2553-anyone at all [he]355-christopher did not care much who it was as long as it was not either [a bounder]2554-a bounder or [a man of [his]355-christopher own class]2555-a man of his own class and race . To be in close mental communion with either [an English bounder]2556-an english bounder or [an Englishman of good family]2557-an englishman of good family would , [he]355-christopher was aware , be intolerable to [him]355-christopher . But , for a little shivering , [artistic Jew]373-artistic jew , as of old for [Macmaster]372-lady macmaster , ht ? was quite capable of feeling a real fondness — as [you]2558-you might for an animal . [Their]2559-their manners were not [your]2558-you manners and could not be expected to be , and whatever [their]2559-their intelligences , [they]2559-their would have a certain little alertness , a certain exactness of thought . . . . Besides , if [they]2559-their did [you]2558-you in , as [every business partner or protégé]2560-every business partner or protégé must be expected to do , [you]2558-you did not feel the same humiliation as [you]2558-you did if [you]2558-you were swindled by [a man of [your]2558-you own race]2561-a man of your own race and station . In the one case it was only what was to be expected , in the other [you]2558-you were faced with the fact that [your]2558-you own tradition had broken down . And under the long strain of the war [he]355-christopher had outgrown alike the mentality and the traditions of [[his]355-christopher own family]2562-his own family and [[his]355-christopher own race]2563-his own race . [The one and the other]2564-the one and the other were not fitted to endure long strains . So [he]355-christopher welcomed the imploring glances and the eventual Oriental gratitude of [that little man in [his]355-christopher unhappy tent]2565-that little man in his unhappy tent . For , naturally , by communicating in [his]355-christopher weighty manner with [the United States Headquarters]103-the united states headquarters when [he]355-christopher happened to find [himself]355-christopher in [[its]103-the united states headquarters vicinity]2566-its vicinity , [he]355-christopher secured the release of [the little fellow , who was by now safely back somewhere in [the interior of [the North American Continent]104-the north american continent]2568-the interior of the north american continent]2567-the little fellow , who was by now safely back somewhere in the interior of the north american continent . But before that happened [he]355-christopher had exchanged a certain amount of correspondence with [Sir John]371-sir john , and had discovered from [him]371-sir john and from [one or two chance members of [the American Expeditionary Force]105-the american expeditionary force]2569-one or two chance members of the american expeditionary force that [the little man]2570-the little man was quite [a good old - furniture dealer]2571-a good old - furniture dealer . [Sir John]371-sir john had by that time gone out of business and [his]371-sir john letters were not particularly cordial to [Tietjens]289-sylvia — Which was only what was to be expected if [Sylvia]289-sylvia had been shedding [her]289-sylvia charms over [him]355-christopher . But it had appeared that [Mr. Schatzweiler]370-mr. schatzweiler had had a great deal of business with [Sir John]371-sir john , who had indeed supplied [him]370-mr. schatzweiler with a great part of [his]370-mr. schatzweiler material , and so , if [Sir John]371-sir john had gone out of business , [Mr. Schatzweiler]370-mr. schatzweiler would need to find in [England]15-england [someone]2458-someone to take [[Sir John]371-sir john ’s place]2573-sir john ’s place . And that was not going to be extraordinarily easy , for what with the amount of [his]355-christopher money that [the Germans]230-the germans had mopped up — [they]230-the germans had sold [him]355-christopher immense quantities of old furniture and got paid for it , and had then enlisted [him]355-christopher in the ranks of [[their]230-the germans Brandenburgers]2574-their brandenburgers , where naturally [he]355-christopher could do nothing with carved oak chests that had elaborate steel hinges and locks . . . . What then with that , and [his]355-christopher prolonged absence from [the neighbourhood of [Detroit]106-detroit]2575-the neighbourhood of detroit , where [he]355-christopher had mostly found [[his]355-christopher buyers]2576-his buyers , [Mr. Schatzweiler]370-mr. schatzweiler found [himself]355-christopher extremely hampered in [his]355-christopher activities . It therefore fell to [Christopher]355-christopher , if [he]355-christopher was to go into partnership with [the now sanguine and charming Oriental]2577-the now sanguine and charming oriental , to supply an immediate sum of money . That had not been easy , but by means of mortgaging [his]355-christopher pay and [his]355-christopher blood — money , and selling the books that [Sylvia]289-sylvia had left [him]355-christopher , [he]355-christopher had been able to provide [Mr. Schatzweiler]370-mr. schatzweiler with enough to make at least a start somewhere across [the water]2578-the water . . . . [And Mr. Schatzweiler]370-mr. schatzweiler and [Christopher]355-christopher had between [them]2579-them evolved an ingenious scheme along lines that [the American]2580-the american had long contemplated , taking into account the tastes of [[his]355-christopher countrymen]2581-his countrymen and the nature of the times . [Mark]352-mark had listened to [[his]352-mark brother]1065-his brother during all this with indulgence and even with pleasure . If [a Tietjens]289-sylvia contemplated going into trade [he]355-christopher might at least contemplate an amusing trade carried on in a spirited manner . And what [Christopher]355-christopher humorously projected was at least more dignified than stockbroking or bill - discounting . Moreover , [he]352-mark was pretty well convinced by this time that [[his]352-mark brother]1065-his brother was completely reconciled to [him]352-mark and to [Groby]217-groby . It was about then and when [he]352-mark had again begun to introduce the topic of [Groby]217-groby that [Christopher]355-christopher got up from the chair at the bedside that [he]355-christopher had been occupying and , having taken [[his]355-christopher brother]1065-his brother ’s wrist in [his]355-christopher cool fingers , remarked : “ [Your]1065-his brother temperature ’s pretty well down . Do n’t [you]1065-his brother think it is about time that [you]1065-his brother set about marrying [Charlotte]374-charlotte ? [I]0-i suppose [you]1065-his brother mean to marry [her]374-charlotte before this bout is finished ; [you]1065-his brother might have a relapse . ” [Mark]352-mark remembered that speech perfectly well , with the addition that if [he]352-mark , [Christopher]355-christopher , hurried about it [they]2585-they might get the job done that night . It must therefore then have been about one o’clock of an afternoon about three weeks before the 11th November , 1918 . [Mark]352-mark had replied that [he]352-mark would be much obliged to [Christopher]355-christopher , and [Christopher]355-christopher , having roused [Marie Léonie]360-marie léonie and told [her]360-marie léonie that [he]355-christopher would be back in time to let [her]360-marie léonie have a good night ’s rest , disappeared , saying that [he]355-christopher was going straight to [Lambeth]107-lambeth . In those days , supposing [you]2586-you could command thirty pounds or so , there was no difficulty in getting married at the shortest possible notice , and [Christopher]355-christopher had promoted too many last — minute marriages amongst [[his]355-christopher men]2587-his men not to know the ropes . [Mark]352-mark viewed the transaction with a good deal of satisfaction . It had needed no arguing ; if the proceeding had the approval of [the heir - presumptive]2588-the heir - presumptive to [Groby]217-groby there was nothing more to be said against it . And [Mark]352-mark took the View that if [he]352-mark agreed to a proceeding that [Christopher]355-christopher could only have counselled as [heir - presumptive]2589-heir - presumptive , that was an additional reason for [Mark]352-mark ’s expecting that [Christopher]355-christopher would eventually consent to administer [Groby]217-groby [himself]355-christopher . Chapter 6

THAT would have been three weeks before the eleventh of November . [His]355-christopher mind boggled a little at computing what the actual date in October must have been . With [his]355-christopher then pneumonia [his]355-christopher mind had not much registered the dates of that period ; days had gone by in fever and boredom . Still , [a man]757-a man ought to remember the date of [his]757-a man wedding . Say it had been the twentieth of October , 1918 . The twentieth of October had been [[his]355-christopher father]670-his father ’s birthday . When [he]355-christopher came to think of it [he]355-christopher could remember remembering hazily that it was queer that [he]355-christopher should be going out of life on the date [[his]355-christopher father]670-his father had entered it . It made a sort of full stop . And it made a full stop that , practically on that day , [Papists]2593-papists entered into [their]2593-papists own in [Groby]217-groby . [He]355-christopher had , that is to say , made up [his]355-christopher mind to the fact that [[Christopher]355-christopher ’s son]1771-christopher ’s son would have [Groby]217-groby as [a home]2595-a home even if [Christopher]355-christopher did n’t . And [the boy]1269-the boy was by now [a full - fledged Papist , pickled and oiled and wafered and all]2597-a full - fledged papist , pickled and oiled and wafered and all . [Sylvia]289-sylvia had rubbed the fact in about a week ago by sending [him]355-christopher a card for [[his]355-christopher nephew]2598-his nephew ’s provisional baptism and first communion about a week before . It had astonished [him]355-christopher that [he]355-christopher had not felt more bitter . [He]355-christopher had not any doubt that the fact had reconciled [him]355-christopher to [his]355-christopher marriage with [Marie Léonie]360-marie léonie . [He]355-christopher had told [[his]355-christopher brother]1065-his brother a year or so before that [he]355-christopher would never marry [her]360-marie léonie because [she]360-marie léonie was [a Papist]2394-a papist , but [he]355-christopher was aware that then [he]355-christopher was only chipping at [Spelden]375-spelden , [the fellow that wrote “ [Spelden]375-spelden on Sacrilege , ” a book that predicted all sorts of disaster for [fellows who owned [former Papist Church lands]2603-former papist church lands or who had displaced [Papists]376-papists]2602-fellows who owned former papist church lands or who had displaced papists]2601-the fellow that wrote “ spelden on sacrilege , ” a book that predicted all sorts of disaster for fellows who owned former papist church lands or who had displaced papists . When [he]355-christopher had told [Christopher]355-christopher that [he]355-christopher would never marry [Charlotte]374-charlotte — [he]355-christopher had called [her]374-charlotte [Charlotte]374-charlotte for reasons of camouflage before the marriage — [he]355-christopher had been quite aware that [he]355-christopher was chipping at [Spelden]375-spelden ’s ghost — for [Spelden]375-spelden must have been dead a hundred years or so . As it were , [he]355-christopher had been saying grimly if pleasantly to that bogy : “ Eh , [old un]2604-old un . [You]2604-old un see . [You]2604-old un may prophesy disaster to [Groby]217-groby because [a Tietjens]289-sylvia was given it over the head of [one of [[your]2604-old un fellows]2606-your fellows in [Dutch William]396-dutch william ’s time]2605-one of your fellows in dutch william ’s time . [He]355-christopher would swear that no idea of disaster to [Groby]217-groby had entered [his]355-christopher head at the date of the marriage . Now , [he]355-christopher would not say ; but of what [he]355-christopher felt then [he]355-christopher was certain . [He]355-christopher remembered thinking whilst the ceremony was going on of the words of [Fraser of Lovat]377-fraser of lovat before [they]2610-they executed [him]355-christopher in [the Forty – Five]2611-the forty – five . [They]2610-they had told [him]355-christopher on the scaffold that if [he]355-christopher would make some sort of sub - mission to [George II]378-george ii [they]2610-they would spare [his]355-christopher body from being exhibited in quarters 011 the spikes of [the buildings in [Edinburgh]109-edinburgh]2612-the buildings in edinburgh . And [Fraser]377-fraser of lovat had answered [I]0-i : “ [An the King]2613-an the king will have [my]0-i heid [I]0-i care not what [he]2613-an the king may do with [my]0-i , ” naming a part of [a gentleman that is not now mentioned in drawing - rooms]2614-a gentleman that is not now mentioned in drawing - rooms . So , if [a Papist]2394-a papist was to inhabit [Groby House]110-groby house , it mattered precious little if the first [Lady Tietjens of Groby]286-groby were [Papist]2616-papist or [Heathen]2617-heathen . [A man]757-a man as a rule does not marry [[his]757-a man mistress]2619-his mistress whilst [he]757-a man has any kick in [him]757-a man . If [he]757-a man still aims at a career it might hinder [him]757-a man if [she]2619-his mistress were known to have been [[his]757-a man mistress]2619-his mistress , or , of course , [a fellow who wants to make a career]2621-a fellow who wants to make a career might want to help [himself]2621-a fellow who wants to make a career on by making a good marriage . Even if [a man]757-a man does not want to make a career [he]757-a man may think that [a woman who has been [[his]757-a man mistress]2619-his mistress as like as not may cuckold [him]757-a man after marriage , for , if [she]2619-his mistress has gone wrong with [him]757-a man , [she]2619-his mistress would be more apt to go wrong elsewhere as well]2623-a woman who has been his mistress as like as not may cuckold him after marriage , for , if she has gone wrong with him , she would be more apt to go wrong elsewhere as well . But if [a fellow]1603-a fellow is practically finished those considerations disappear , and [he]1603-a fellow remembers that [you]2626-you go to hell if [you]2626-you seduce [virgins]2627-virgins . It is as well at one time or another to make [your]2626-you peace with [[your]2626-you Creator]2628-your creator . For ever is a long word and [God]257-god is said to disapprove of unconsecrated unions . Besides , it would very likely please [Marie Léonie]360-marie léonie , though [she]360-marie léonie had never said a word about it , and it would certainly dish [Sylvia]289-sylvia , who was no doubt counting on being the first [Lady Tietjens of Groby]286-groby . And then , too , it would undoubtedly make [Marie Léonie]360-marie léonie safer . In one way and another [he]757-a man had given [[his]757-a man mistress]2619-his mistress quite a number of things that might well be desirable to [that bitch]1857-that bitch , and neither [his]757-a man not [Christopher]355-christopher ’s lives were worth much , whilst Chancery can be a very expensive affair if [you]2626-you get into it . And [he]757-a man was aware that [he]757-a man had always had a soft spot in [his]757-a man heart for [Marie Léonie]360-marie léonie , otherwise [he]757-a man would not have provided [her]2619-his mistress with the name of [Charlotte]374-charlotte for public consumption .
