[Marie Léonit Riotor]379-marie léonit riotor looks different from a casual [Charlotte]374-charlotte . It gives [her]2619-his mistress a better chance in [the world outside]2634-the world outside . So it had been well enough . [The world]522-the world was . changing and there was no particular reason why [he]757-a man should not change with it . . . . And [he]757-a man had not been able to conceal from [himself]757-a man that [he]757-a man was getting on the way . Time lengthened out . When [he]757-a man had come in drenched from one of the potty local meetings that [they]2636-they had had to fall back on during the war [he]757-a man had known that something was coming to [him]757-a man , because after [Marie Léonie]360-marie léonie had tucked [him]757-a man up in bed [he]757-a man could not remember the strain of [the winner of some handicap of no importance]2637-the winner of some handicap of no importance . [Marie Léonie]360-marie léonie had given [him]757-a man a goodish tot of mm with butter in it and that might have made [him]757-a man hazy — but , all the same , that had never happened to [him]757-a man in [his]757-a man life before , rum or no rum . And by now [he]757-a man had forgotten even the name of [the winner]2638-the winner and the meeting . . . . [He]757-a man could not conceal from [himself]757-a man that [his]757-a man memory was failing , though otherwise [he]757-a man considered [himself]757-a man to be as sound a man as [he]757-a man had ever been . But when it came to memory , ever since that day [his]757-a man brain had checked at times as a tired horse will at a fence . . . . [A tired horse]2639-a tired horse ! [He]757-a man could not bring [himself]757-a man to the computation of what three weeks back from the eleventh of November came to ; [his]757-a man brain would not go at it . For the matter of that , [he]757-a man could remember precious little of the events of that three weeks in their due order . [Christopher]355-christopher had certainly been about , relieving [Marie Léonie]360-marie léonie at night and attending to [him]757-a man with a soft , goggle - eyed attentiveness that [only a man with a saint for a mother]2640-only a man with a saint for a mother could have put up . For hours and hours [he]355-christopher would read aloud in [Boswell]380-boswell ’s “ Life of [Johnson]381-johnson , ” for which [Mark]352-mark had had a fancy . And [Mark]352-mark could remember drowsing off with satisfaction to the sound of the voice and drowsing with satisfaction awake again , still to the sound of the voice . For [Christopher]355-christopher had the idea that if [his]355-christopher voice went droning on it would make [Mark]352-mark ’s slumbers more satisfactory . Satisfaction . . . . Perhaps the last satisfaction that [Mark]352-mark was ever to know . For at that time - during those three weeks — [he]757-a man had not been able to believe that [Christopher]355-christopher really meant to stick out about the matter of [Groby]286-groby . How could [you]2641-you believe that [a fellow who waited on [you]2641-you with the softness of [a girl built of meal - sacks]2643-a girl built of meal - sacks]2642-a fellow who waited on you with the softness of a girl built of meal - sacks was determined to . . . call it , break [your]2641-you heart . That was what it came to . . . . [A fellow]1603-a fellow , too , who agreed in the most astounding manner with [your]2641-you views of things in general . [A fellow]1603-a fellow , for the matter of that , who knew ten times as much as [you]2641-you did . [A damn learned fellow]2646-a damn learned fellow . . . . [Mark]352-mark had no contempt for learning - particularly for [younger sons]2647-younger sons . [The country]1025-the country was going to the dogs because of the want of education of [the younger sons]2649-the younger sons , whose business it was to do the work of [the nation]594-the nation . It was [a very old North Country]2651-a very old north country rhyme that , that when land is gone and money spent , then learning is most excellent . N 0 , [he]352-mark had no contempt for learning . [He]352-mark had never acquired any because [he]352-mark was too lazy : a little Sallust , a little [Cornelius Nepos]382-cornelius nepos , a touch of [Horace]383-horace , enough French to read a novel and follow what [Marie Léonie]360-marie léonie said . . . , Even to [himself]352-mark [he]352-mark called [her]360-marie léonie [Marie Léonie]360-marie léonie once [he]352-mark was married to [her]360-marie léonie . [[Their]2653-their father]2169-their father , [a younger son]2166-a younger son at the beginning , had been damn learned , too . [They]2653-their said that even at [his]2169-their father death [he]2169-their father had been [one of [the best Latinists in [England]15-england]2657-the best latinists in england]2656-one of the best latinists in england — [the intimate friend of [that fellow Wannop]2659-that fellow wannop]2658-the intimate friend of that fellow wannop , [the Professor]2660-the professor . . . . A great age at which to die by [his]2169-their father own hand , [[his]2169-their father father]670-his father ’s ! Great changes ! Yet [Father]300-father had not been [an incult sort of a man]2664-an incult sort of a man . On the contrary , if [he]300-father was burly and determined , [he]300-father was quiet . Did [he]300-father commit suicide ? If so then [Valentine Wannop]191-valentine was [[his]300-father daughter]2688-his daughter . That was the sort of thing that would happen to [a Tietjens of the Christopher variety]2701-a tietjens of the christopher variety : to [any Tietjens who would not get out or get under]2702-any tietjens who would not get out or get under as [he]355-christopher , [Mark]352-mark , had done . [Tietjenses]279-tietjenses took what [they]279-tietjenses damn well got for doing what [they]279-tietjenses damn well wanted to . Well , it landed [them]279-tietjenses in that sort of post . . . . [Spelden]375-spelden might well be justified . [The grandfather of [Father]1431-father scalped by [Indians]386-indians in [Canada]114-canada]2705-the grandfather of father scalped by indians in canada in the war of 1812 ; [the father]2694-the father dying in a place where [he]2694-the father should not have been — taking what [he]2694-the father got for it and causing quite a scandal for [the Court of [Victoria]116-victoria]115-the court of victoria ; [the elder brother of [Father]300-father]2708-the elder brother of father killed drunk whilst fox - hunting ; [Father]1431-father suicided ; [Christopher]355-christopher a pauper by [his]355-christopher own act with a by - blow in [his]355-christopher shoes . [Groby Great Tree]217-groby had been planted to commemorate the birth of [Great — grand - father]2714-great — grand - father who had died in [a whoreshop]2715-a whoreshop — and it had always been whispered in [Groby]217-groby , amongst [the children]595-the children and [servants]2717-servants , that [Groby Great Tree]217-groby did not like [the house]585-the house . Its roots tore chunks out of the foundations , and two or three times the trunk had had to be bricked into the front wall . It had been brought as a sapling from [Sardinia]117-sardinia at a time when [gentlemen]1306-gentlemen still thought about landscape gardening . [A gentleman in those days]2720-a gentleman in those days consulted [[his]2720-a gentleman in those days heirs]2721-his heirs about tree planting . Should [you]2722-you plant a group of copper beeches against a group of white maples over against the ha - ha a quarter of a mile from [the house]585-the house so that the contrast seen from the ball - room windows should be agreeable — in thirty years ’ time ? An American day ! Well , why not ? It was impossible to know which ! Yes , [his]355-christopher confounded heart had been broken on Armistice Day in the morning — between the morning and the morning after . . . . Yes : after [Christopher]355-christopher had been reading [Boswell]380-boswell aloud , night after night for three weeks . . . . Was that playing the game ? Was it playing the game to get no sleep if [you]2772-you had not forgiven [[your]2772-you brother]741-your brother . . . . Oh , no doubt it was playing the game . [You]2772-you do n’t forgive [[your]2772-you brother]741-your brother if [he]741-your brother lets [you]2772-you down in a damn beastly way . . . . But the sweat burst out all over [his]355-christopher face at the recollection : great drops of sweat . Chapter 7

[MARIE LEONIE]220-marie leonie , a strong taste of apples in [her]220-marie leonie mouth , strong savours of apples on the air , wasps around [her]220-marie leonie and as if a snow - drift of down descending about [her]220-marie leonie feet , was frowning seriously over Burgundy bottles into which ran cider from a glass tube that [she]220-marie leonie held to [their]2857-their necks . [She]220-marie leonie frowned because the task was serious and engrossing , because the wasps annoyed [her]220-marie leonie and because [she]220-marie leonie was resisting an impulse inside [herself]220-marie leonie . It told [her]220-marie leonie that something ailed [Mark]352-mark and urged [her]220-marie leonie to go and look at [him]352-mark . It annoyed [her]220-marie leonie because , as a rule — a rule so strong that it had assumed the aspect of a regulation - [she]220-marie leonie felt presages of something ailing [Mark]352-mark only at night . Only at night ‘ . During the day usually [she]220-marie leonie felt in [her]220-marie leonie for intérizur that [Mark]352-mark was like what [he]352-mark was only because [he]352-mark wanted so to be . [His]352-mark glance was too virile and dominant to let [you]2858-you think other - wise — the dark , liquid , direct glance ! But at nightfall — or at any rate shortly after supper when [she]220-marie leonie had retired to [[her]220-marie leonie room]826-her room terrible premonitions of disaster to [Mark]352-mark visited [her]220-marie leonie . [He]352-mark was dying where [he]352-mark lay ; [he]352-mark was beset by the spectral beings of [the countryside]2860-the countryside ; [robbers]2861-robbers , even , had crept upon [him]352-mark , though that was unreasonable . For all [the countryside]2860-the countryside knew that [Mark]352-mark was paralysed and unable to store wealth in [his]352-mark mattress . . . . Still , [nefarious strangers]2863-nefarious strangers might see [him]352-mark and imagine that [he]352-mark kept [his]352-mark gold repeater watch beneath [his]352-mark pillow . . . . So [she]220-marie leonie would rise a hundred times in a night and , going to the low , diamond - casement window , would lean out and listen . But there would be no sound : the wind in the leaves ; the cry of water - birds over head . The dim light would be in [the hut]541-the hut , seen unmoving through the apple — boughs . Now , however , in broad daylight , towards the hour of tea , with [the little maid]1139-the little maid on a stool beside [her]220-marie leonie plucking the boiling - hens that were to go to market next day , with the boxes of eggs on [their]2866-their shelves , each egg wired to the bottom of its box , waiting till [she]220-marie leonie had time to date - stamp it — in the open potting - shed in the quiet , broad light of a summer day [she]220-marie leonie was visited by:1 presage of some - thing ailing [Mark]352-mark . [She]220-marie leonie resented it , but [she]220-marie leonie was not [the woman to resist it]2867-the woman to resist it . There was , however , nothing to warrant it . From the corner of [the house to which [she]220-marie leonie proceeded]2868-the house to which she proceeded [she]220-marie leonie could see quite well the greater part of [Mark]352-mark ’s solitary figure . [Gunning]200-gunning , being talked to ‘ by [the English lord]2869-the english lord , held a spare horse by the bridle and was looking at [Mark]352-mark over the hedge . [He]200-gunning exhibited no emotions . [A young man]2870-a young man was walking along the inside of the hedge between [it]2871-it and the raspberries . That was no affair of [hers]220-marie leonie : [Gunning]200-gunning was not protesting . The head and shoulders of [a young woman]713-a young woman — or it might be [another young man]2873-another young man — were proceeding along the outside of the hedge nearly level with [the first one]2874-the first one . That was equally no affair of [hers]220-marie leonie . Probably [they]2875-they were looking at the bird ’s nest . There was some sort of bird ’s nest , [she]220-marie leonie had heard , in that thick hedge . There was no end to the folly of [the English]266-the english in [the country]1025-the country as in [the town]2678-the town : [they]266-the english would waste time over everything . This bird was a bottle . . . bottle - something , and [Christopher]355-christopher and [Valentine]191-valentine and [the parson]2878-the parson and [the doctor]542-the doctor and [the artist who lived down [the hill]581-the hill]2880-the artist who lived down the hill were crazy about it . [They]2875-they walked on tiptoe when [they]2875-they were within twenty yards . [Gunning]200-gunning was allowed to trim the hedge , but apparently the birds knew [Gunning]200-gunning . . . . For [Marie Léonie]360-marie léonie , all birds were “ moineaux ” ; as who should say “ sparrers ” ; in [London]22-london [they]2875-they called [them]2882-them that — just as all flowers were “ giroflées”—as [you]2883-you might say wall - flowers . . . . No wonder [this nation]602-this nation was going to rack and min when it wasted its time over preserving the nests of sparrers and naming innumerable wall - flowers ! [The country]1025-the country was well enough — [a sort of suburb of Caen]2886-a sort of suburb of caen : but [the people]2887-the people ! . . . no wonder [William]396-dutch william , of [Falaise]28-falaise , in [Normandy]124-normandy subjugated [them]2887-the people with such case . [She]360-marie léonie disliked having to do that ; it wasted the cider and [she]360-marie léonie disliked the flavour in the afternoon when [one]491-one had lunched . Could [these savages]2894-these savages never understand that if [you]2895-you want to have cidr : moureux — foaming — [you]2895-you must have as little sediment as possible ? And that in the bottom of casks , even if they had not been moved for a long time , there will always be sediment — particularly if [you]2895-you set up a How in the liquid by running it from a tap near the bottom . So [you]2895-you siphon off the top of the great casks for bottling moumux , and drink the rest from the cask , and run the thickest into little thin — wood casks with many hoops for freezing in the winter . . . . To make calvados where [you]2895-you can not have alembics because of the excise . . . . [Quel]397-quel pays ! Quels gens ! [They]2897-they lacked industry , frugality — and , above all , spirit ! [She]360-marie léonie had been for bidding [them]3013-they go away , but [Mark]352-mark had come out of [the bedroom]3015-the bedroom . In [his]352-mark nightshirt with [his]352-mark legs bare . Now , [he]352-mark having been in bed so long , [his]352-mark legs were no longer hairy , but polished . Like thin glazed bones ! [She]360-marie léonie had recalled [his]352-mark last gesture . [He]352-mark had positively used a gesture , like [a man]757-a man raving . . . . And , indeed , [he]352-mark was raving . At [Christopher]355-christopher . And dripping with sweat . Twice [she]360-marie léonie had wiped [his]352-mark face whilst [they]3013-they shouted at [each other]791-each other . It had been difficult to understand what [they]3013-they said because [they]3013-they had spoken a sort of patois . Naturally [they]3013-they returned to the language [they]3013-they had spoken in [their]3013-they childhoods — when [they]3013-they were excited , [these unexcitable people]3018-these unexcitable people ! It resembled the patois of [the Bretons]3019-the bretons . Harsh . . . . And , for [herself]360-marie léonie , [she]360-marie léonie had been all concerned for [the girl]593-the girl . Naturally [she]360-marie léonie had been concerned for [the girl]593-the girl . [One]491-one is [a woman]1049-a woman . . . . At first [she]360-marie léonie had taken [her]593-the girl for a little piece from [the streets]2087-the streets . . . . But even for a little piece from [the streets]2087-the streets . . . Then [she]360-marie léonie had noticed that there had been no rouge ; no imitation pearl necklace . . . . Of course when [she]360-marie léonie had gathered that [Mark]352-mark was pressing money on [them]3013-they [she]360-marie léonie had felt different . Different in two ways . It could not be a little piece . And then [her]360-marie léonie heart had contracted at the idea of money being given away . [They]3013-they might be ruined . It might be [these people]3026-these people instead of [[her]360-marie léonie Paris nephews who would pillage [her]360-marie léonie corpse]3027-her paris nephews who would pillage her corpse . But [the brother - in - law]2928-the brother - in - law pushed the thought of money away from [him]352-mark with both hands . If [she]360-marie léonie — [Elle]219-elle — wanted to go with [him]352-mark [she]360-marie léonie must share [his]352-mark fortunes . . . . What [a country]2378-a country ! What [people]1333-people ! There had seemed to be no understanding [them]3013-they then . . . . [The girl]593-the girl kept saying that on no account would [she]593-the girl leave [Christopher]355-christopher . [He]355-christopher could not be left . [He]355-christopher would die if [he]355-christopher was left . . . . And , indeed , [that brother — in — law]3037-that brother — in — law had seemed sick enough . [He]355-christopher panted worse than [Mark]352-mark . [She]593-the girl had eventually taken [the girl]593-the girl to [[her]593-the girl own room]2439-her own room . [A little , agonized , fair creature]3040-a little , agonized , fair creature . [She]593-the girl had felt inclined to enfold [her]593-the girl in [her]593-the girl arms but [she]593-the girl had not done so . Because of the money . . . . [She]593-the girl might as well have . It was impossible to get [these people]3026-these people to touch money . [She]593-the girl would now give no little to lend [that girl]627-that girl twenty pounds for a frock and some under - garments . [The girl]593-the girl had sat there without speaking . It had seemed for hours . Then [some drunken man on the church steps opposite]3044-some drunken man on the church steps opposite had begun to play the bugle . [Long calls . . . . Tee . . . Teee . . . [Valentine]191-valentine had begun to cry . [She]191-valentine had said that it was dreadful . But [you]3046-you could not object . It was the Last Post [they]3047-they were playing . For [the Dead]3048-the dead . [You]3046-you could not object to [their]3047-they playing the Last Post for [the Dead]404-the dead that night . Even if it was [a drunken man]3049-a drunken man who played and even if it drove [you]3046-you mad . [The Dead]3048-the dead ought to have all [they]3048-the dead could get . If [she]191-valentine had not made the necessary allowances that would have seemed to [Marie Léonie]360-marie léonie an exaggerated sentiment . [The English bugle]3051-the english bugle — notes could do no good to [the French dead]3052-the french dead and the English losses were so negligible in quantity that it hardly seemed worth while to become émotionnée when [their]3048-the dead funeral call was played by [a drunken man]3049-a drunken man . The French papers estimated the English losses at a few hundreds : what was that as against [the millions of [[her]191-valentine own people]3055-her own people]3054-the millions of her own people ? . . . But [she]191-valentine gathered that [this girl]3056-this girl had gone through something terrible that night with [the wife]1877-the wife , and being too proud to show emotion over [her]191-valentine personal vicissitudes [she]191-valentine pretended to find an outlet because of the sounds of that bugle . . . . Well , it was mournful enough . [She]191-valentine had understood it when [Christopher]355-christopher , putting [his]355-christopher face in at the crack of the door , had whispered to [her]191-valentine that [he]355-christopher was going to stop the bugle because its sound was intolerable to [Mark]352-mark . [The girl]593-the girl apparently had been in a reverie , for [she]593-the girl had not heard [him]352-mark . [She]593-the girl , [Marie Léonie]360-marie léonie , had gone to look at [Mark]352-mark , and [the girl]593-the girl sat there , on the bed . [Mark]352-mark was by then quite quiescent . To cheer [him]352-mark [she]191-valentine had made a few remarks about the inappropriateness of playing , for [a negligible number of dead]3060-a negligible number of dead , a funeral call at three in the morning . If it had been for [the French dead]3052-the french dead — or if [[her]191-valentine country]1421-her country had not been betrayed ! It was betraying [[her]191-valentine country]1421-her country to have given [those monsters]3064-those monsters an armistice when [they]3064-those monsters were far from [[their]3064-those monsters borders]3065-their borders . Even out of justice to [the poor bloody Germans]3074-the poor bloody germans . . . . [He]352-mark had called [them]3074-the poor bloody germans [the poor bloody Germans]3074-the poor bloody germans . Even in that obscure street mobs went by , shouting and playing concertinas . [She]593-the girl had never heard [Mark]352-mark discuss before — and [she]593-the girl was never to hear [him]352-mark discuss again . And [Marie Léonie]360-marie léonie had watched [them]3085-those two and listened with intentness . [She]593-the girl kept on recurring to the idea that punishment was abhorrent to [the modern mind]3092-the modern mind . [Mark]352-mark stuck to [his]352-mark point that to occupy [Berlin]101-berlin was not punishment , but that not to occupy [Berlin]101-berlin was to commit an intellectual sin . The consequence of invasion is counter - invasion and symbolical occupation , as the consequence of over - pride is humiliation . For [the rest of [the world]522-the world]3093-the rest of the world , [he]352-mark knew nothing of it ; for [[his]352-mark own country]2343-his own country that was logic — the logic by which [she]593-the girl had lived . To abandon that logic was to abandon clearness of mind : it was mental cowardice . To show the world [Berlin]101-berlin occupied , with stands of arms and colours on [[her]593-the girl public places]3096-her public places , was to show that [England]15-england respected logic . Not to show [the world]522-the world that , was to show that [England]15-england was mentally cowardly . [We]3098-we dared not put [the enemy nations]2354-the enemy nations to pain because [we]3098-we shrank from the contemplation . [Valentine]191-valentine had said : “ There has been too much suffering ! ” [He]3100-he had said : “ Yes , [you]3101-you are afraid of suffering . . . . [The Minister]3184-the minister had said with a sort of heavy joy that [they]3179-they were not going into [Germany]93-germany : and that had been the most dreadful moment of [Marie Léonie]360-marie léonie ’s life ; but with [her]3184-the minister discipline [she]3184-the minister had just simply repeated the words to [Mark]352-mark . But [one]491-one must adapt [oneself]491-one to one ’s day ; the times were changed . [She]3184-the minister had gone from the instrument to look at [Mark]352-mark . [She]3184-the minister spoke to [him]352-mark ; [she]3184-the minister spoke to [him]352-mark again . And again — rapid words of panic . [His]352-mark face was dark purple and congested ; [he]352-mark gazed straight before [him]352-mark . [She]3184-the minister raised [him]352-mark ; [he]352-mark sank back inertly . But [Mark]407-mark had finished with [the Ministry]798-the ministry , with [the Government]73-the government , with [the nation]594-the nation . . . . With [the world]522-the world . [He]355-christopher had come round with [Valentine]191-valentine in tow . It had certainly not been much of a nuit dc note : for [that young couple]3201-that young couple . Part Two

Chapter 1

[SYLVIA TIETJENS]289-sylvia , using the persuasion of [her]289-sylvia left knee , edged [her]289-sylvia chestnut nearer to [the bay mare of [the shining general]3203-the shining general]3202-the bay mare of the shining general . [She]289-sylvia said : “ If [I]0-i divorce [Christopher]355-christopher , will [you]3203-the shining general marry [me]0-i ? ” [He]355-christopher exclaimed with the vehemence of [a shocked hen]3204-a shocked hen : “ Good God , no ! ” [He]355-christopher shone everywhere except in such parts of [his]355-christopher grey tweed suit as would have shown by shining that they had been put on more than once . But [his]355-christopher little white moustache , [his]355-christopher checks , the bridge but not the tip of [his]355-christopher nose , [his]355-christopher reins , [his]355-christopher Guards ’ tie , [his]355-christopher boots , martingale , snaffle , curb , fingers , finger - nails — all these gave evidence of interminable rubbings . . . . [She]289-sylvia had been ingenious even for [her]289-sylvia ; but [she]289-sylvia was aware that afterwards [Fittleworth]417-fittleworth had had a long bedroom talk with [[his]3368-that peer [Cammie]389-fittleworth]3372-his cammie . [The Master]3374-the master and [the Mistress]3375-the mistress — upon a word , usually from [the Master]3374-the master — take [themselves]3379-themselves off , and [the house - guests]3380-the house - guests , at any rate in a small party , straggle , are uncertain as to who gives the signal to retire , suppress yawns even . The dusky purple under [Fittleworth]389-fittleworth ’s skin showed no diminution . [He]3409-he had done so last night . [He]3409-he had stood a good deal . [Sylvia Tietjens]289-sylvia , for a great number of years , had tormented [[her]289-sylvia husband]1076-her husband . [You]3511-you might have thought that in [her]268-beatrice coercing [Mrs. de Bray Pape]284-mrs. de bray pape and [[her]284-mrs. de bray pape son]3503-her son into making that rather outrageous visit , and in awakening [Mrs. Lowther]193-mrs. lowther ’s innocent curiosity as to the contents of [the cottage]1153-the cottage , [she]268-beatrice had been inspired solely by the desire to torment [Valentine Wannop]191-valentine . The one item [she]289-sylvia had : [The Tietjens]289-sylvia , [she]289-sylvia knew from [Mrs. Carpenter Cramp]273-mrs. cramp , had an immense fireplace in [[their]3527-their living - room]3528-their living - room and , after the time - honoured custom , [they]3527-their smoked [their]3527-their hams in that chimney . But to [people who did not know that smoking hams in great chimneys]3529-people who did not know that smoking hams in great chimneys was a time - honoured custom , the assertion that [Christopher]249-christopher was [the sort of person who dried hams in [[his]3530-the sort of person who dried hams in his drawing - room drawing - room]3531-his drawing - room]3530-the sort of person who dried hams in his drawing - room would bring up images of [your]3532-you finding [yourself]3532-you in a sort of place where hams reclined on the sofa - cushions . But as to [Valentine]191-valentine [she]289-sylvia could not get details enough . [You]3532-you had to prove that [she]289-sylvia was [a bad housekeeper]3537-a bad housekeeper and a blue - stocking in order that it should be apparent that [Christopher]249-christopher was miserable — and [you]3532-you had to prove that [Christopher]249-christopher was miserable in order to make it apparent that the hold that [Valentine Wannop]191-valentine certainly had over [him]3530-the sort of person who dried hams in his drawing - room was something unholy . For that it was necessary to have details of misplaced hairbrushes , frying - pans and copies of [Sappho]432-sappho . It had , however , been difficult to get those details . [Mrs. Cramp]273-mrs. cramp , when appealed to , had made it rather plain that , far from being [a bad housekeeper]3537-a bad housekeeper , [Valentine Wannop]191-valentine did no housekeeping at all , whereas [Marie Léonie]360-marie léonie — [Lady Mark]407-mark — was [a perfect devil of a ménagére]3539-a perfect devil of a ménagére . [The local doctor]3543-the local doctor and [the parson]2878-the parson , both of whom visited [the house]585-the house , had contributed only palely - coloured portraits of [the young woman]880-the young woman . If [he]412-mark were dead or dying beneath that parallelogram of thatch down among the apple boughs all sorts of things might be going to happen . Quite inconvenient things . There would be the title . [She]289-sylvia quite definitely did not want the title , and it would become more difficult to injure [Christopher]249-christopher . [People with titles and great possessions]3791-people with titles and great possessions are vastly more difficult to discredit than [impoverished commoners]3792-impoverished commoners , because the scale of morality changes . Titles and great possessions expose [you]3789-you to great temptations : it is scandalous , on the other hand , that [the indigent]3793-the indigent should have any fun ! So that , sitting rather restfully in the sunlight on [her]289-sylvia horse , [Sylvia]289-sylvia felt like [a general who is losing the fruits of victory]3794-a general who is losing the fruits of victory . [Mr. Carter]442-mr. carter had been potting geranium shoots and [she]289-sylvia had been a little teasing a white kitten . [She]289-sylvia was thirteen , with immense plaits of blonde hair . [She]207-sylvia had begun divorce proceedings against [Christopher]249-christopher , in the way of a petition for restitution of conjugal rights , compounding with the shade of [Father Consett]300-father and [her]207-sylvia conscience as [a Roman Catholic]3249-a roman catholic by arguing that a petition for the restoration of [[your]207-sylvia husband]1853-your husband from [a Strange Woman]3831-a strange woman is not the same as divorce proceedings . In [England]15-england at that date it was a preliminary and caused as much publicity as the real thing to which [she]207-sylvia had no intention of proceeding . [The judge]3844-the judge had protested against the oratory of [Mr. Sylvian Hatt]445-mr. hatt , but [Mr. Hatt]445-mr. hatt had got in already a lurid picture of [Christopher]249-christopher and [Valentine]191-valentine in [a dark , empty house]3845-a dark , empty house on Armistice night throwing [Sylvia]207-sylvia down - stairs and so occasioning in [her]207-sylvia a fell disease from which , under [the court]3846-the court ’s eyes , [she]207-sylvia was fading . This had distressed [Sylvia]207-sylvia [herself]207-sylvia , for , rather with the idea of showing [the court]3846-the court and [the world]522-the world in general what [a fool]1630-a fool [Christopher]249-christopher was to have left [her]207-sylvia for a little brown sparrow , [she]207-sylvia had chosen to appear all radiance and health . [She]207-sylvia had hoped for the appearance of [Valentine]191-valentine in [court]3838-court . It had not occurred . [The judge]3844-the judge had asked [Mr. Hatt]445-mr. hatt if [he]445-mr. hatt really proposed to bring in evidence that [Captain Tietjens]439-captain tietjens and [Miss Wannop]364-miss wannop had enticed [Mrs. Tietjens]249-christopher into [a dark house]3852-a dark house — and on a shake of the head that [Sylvia]207-sylvia had not been able to refrain from giving [Mr. Hatt]445-mr. hatt , [the judge]3844-the judge had made some extremely rude remarks to [[her]207-sylvia counsel]3832-her counsel . [Mr. Hatt]445-mr. hatt was at that time standing as [parliamentary candidate for [a Midland Borough]3856-a midland borough]3855-parliamentary candidate for a midland borough and was anxious to attract as much publicity as that or any other case would give [him]445-mr. hatt . [He]445-mr. hatt had therefore gone bald - headed for [the judge]3844-the judge , even accusing [him]445-mr. hatt of being indifferent to the sufferings [he]445-mr. hatt was causing to [[Mr. Hatt]445-mr. hatt ’s fainting client]3858-mr. hatt ’s fainting client . Rightly handled , impertinence to [a judge]2492-a judge will gain quite a number of votes on [the Radical side of [Midland constituencies]3861-midland constituencies]3860-the radical side of midland constituencies , [judges]3862-judges being supposed to be [all Tories]3863-all tories . Anyhow , the case had been a fiasco from [Sylvia]207-sylvia ’s point of view , and for the first time in [her]207-sylvia life [she]207-sylvia had felt mortification ; in addition [she]207-sylvia had felt a great deal of religious trepidation . It had come into [her]207-sylvia mind in [court]3838-court — and it came with additional vividness there above [that house]3865-that house , that , years ago in [[[her]207-sylvia mother]704-her mother ’s sitting - room in [a place called [Lobscheid]149-lobscheid]3868-a place called lobscheid]3867-her mother ’s sitting - room in a place called lobscheid , [Father Consett]300-father had predicted that if [Christopher]249-christopher fell in love with [another woman]1134-another woman , [she]207-sylvia , [Sylvia]207-sylvia , would perpetrate acts of vulgarity . And there [she]207-sylvia had been , not only toying with the temporal courts in a matter of marriage , which is a sacrament , but led undoubtedly into a position that [she]207-sylvia had to acknowledge was vulgar . [She]207-sylvia had precipitately left [the court]3846-the court when [Mr. Hatt]445-mr. hatt had for the second time appealed for pity for [her]207-sylvia — but [she]207-sylvia had not been able to stop it . . . . Pity ! [She]207-sylvia appeal for pity ! [She]207-sylvia had regarded [herself]207-sylvia — [she]207-sylvia had certainly desired to be regarded — as the sword of [the Lord smiting the craven]3871-the lord smiting the craven and [the traitor]3872-the traitor — to [Beauty]446-beauty ! And was it to be supported that [she]207-sylvia was to be regarded as such [a fool]1630-a fool as to be decoyed into [an empty house]2816-an empty house ! Or as to let [herself]207-sylvia be thrown down [stairs]3875-stairs ! . . . But qui facit per alium is [herself]207-sylvia responsible , and there [she]207-sylvia had been in a position as mortifying as would have been that of [[any city clerk]3876-any city clerk ’s wife]3877-any city clerk ’s wife . The florid periods of [Mr. Hatt]445-mr. hatt had made [her]207-sylvia shiver all over , and [she]207-sylvia had never spoken to [him]445-mr. hatt again . And [her]207-sylvia position had been broadcasted all over [England]15-england — and now , here in the mouth of [this gross henchman]3878-this gross henchman , it had recurred . At the most inconvenient moment . For the thought suddenly recurred , sweeping over with immense force : [God]257-god had changed sides at the cutting down of [Groby Great Tree]217-groby . The first intimation [she]207-sylvia had had that [God]257-god might change sides had occurred in [that hateful court]3879-that hateful court , and had , as it were , been prophesied by [Father Consett]300-father . [That dark saint and martyr]3880-that dark saint and martyr was in [Heaven]2920-heaven , having died for the Faith , and undoubtedly [he]3880-that dark saint and martyr had the ear of [God]257-god . [He]300-father had prophesied that [she]207-sylvia would toy with the temporal courts ; immediately [she]207-sylvia had felt [herself]207-sylvia degraded , as if strength had gone out from [her]207-sylvia . Strength had undoubtedly gone out from [her]207-sylvia . Never before in [her]207-sylvia life had [her]207-sylvia mind not sprung to an emergency . It was all very well to say that [she]207-sylvia could not move physically either backwards or forwards for fear of causing a stampede amongst all those horses and that therefore [her]207-sylvia mental uncertainty might be excused . But it was the finger of [God]257-god — or of [Father Consett]300-father who , as [saint and martyr]3882-saint and martyr , was the agent of [God]257-god . . . . Or perhaps [God]257-god [Himself]257-god was here really taking a hand for the protection of [[His]257-god Christopher]3883-his christopher , who was undoubtedly [an Anglican saint]1802-an anglican saint . . . . [The Almighty]447-the almighty might well be dissatisfied with [the other relatively amiable saint]3885-the other relatively amiable saint ’s conduct of the case , for surely [Father Consett]300-father might be expected to have a soft spot for [her]207-sylvia , whereas [you]3886-you could not expect [the Almighty]447-the almighty to be unfair even to [Anglicans]448-anglicans . . . . At any rate up over [the landscape]3369-the landscape , [the hills]3888-the hills , the sky , [she]207-sylvia felt the shadow of [Father Consett]300-father , the arms extended as if on a gigantic cruciform — and then , above and behind that , an . an August Will ! [Gunning]200-gunning , [his]200-gunning bloodshot eyes fixed on [her]207-sylvia , moved [his]200-gunning lips vindictively . [She]207-sylvia had , in face of those ghostly manifestations across [hills]3889-hills and sky , a moment of real panic . Such as [she]207-sylvia had felt when [they]3890-they had been shelling near [[the hotel]3891-the hotel in [France]18-france]3892-the hotel in france , when [she]207-sylvia had sat amidst palms with [Christopher]249-christopher under a glass roof . . . . A mad desire to run — or as if [your]3886-you soul ran about inside [you]3886-you like a parcel of rats in a pit awaiting an unseen terrier . What was [she]207-sylvia to do ? What the devil was [she]207-sylvia to do ? . . . [She]207-sylvia felt an itch . . . . [She]207-sylvia felt the very devil of a desire to confront at least [Mark Tietjens]199-mark . . . even if it should kill [the fellow]1767-the fellow . Surely [God]257-god could not be unfair ! What was [she]207-sylvia given beauty for — the dangerous remains of beauty!—if not to impress it on the unimpressible ! [She]207-sylvia ought to be given the chance at least once more to try [her]207-sylvia irresistible ram against that immovable post before . . . [She]207-sylvia was aware . . . . [Gunning]200-gunning was saying something to the effect that if [she]207-sylvia caused [Mrs. Valentine]449-valentine to have a miscarriage or [an idiot child]3894-an idiot child , Is [Lordship]198-gunning woul flay all the flesh off [er]3895-er bones with is own ridin crop . [The child]1959-the child was bore dead . The words conveyed little to [her]207-sylvia . . . . [She]207-sylvia was aware . . . . [She]207-sylvia was aware . . . . A fantastic object was descending at a fly - crawl [the hill - road that went almost vertically up to [the farm]1221-the farm amongst the beeches]3899-the hill - road that went almost vertically up to the farm amongst the beeches . What ’s that [i]0-i ” . . . Then it came back to [her]207-sylvia that [Gunning]198-gunning had suggested that [she]207-sylvia might give [Valentine]449-valentine a miscarriage . . . . [Her]207-sylvia breath made a little clittering sound , like the trituration of barley ears , in [her]207-sylvia throat ; [her]207-sylvia gloved hands , reins and all , were over [her]207-sylvia eyes , smelling of morocco leather ; [she]207-sylvia felt as if within [her]207-sylvia a shelf dropped away — as the platform drops away from beneath the feet of [a convict]3903-a convict [they]3903-a convict are hanging . Descending the hill at the fly ’s pace was the impossible . [A black basket - work pony phaeton]3904-a black basket - work pony phaeton : the pony — [you]3905-you always look at the horse first — four hands too big ; as round as a barrel , as shining as a mahogany dining - table , pacing for all [the world]522-the world like a baut : [école circus steed]3907-école circus steed , and in a panic bumping its behind into [that black vehicle]3908-that black vehicle . It eased [her]207-sylvia to see . . . . But . . . fantastically horrible , behind that grotesque coward of a horse , holding the reins , was a black thing , like a funeral charger ; beside it a top hat , a white face , a buff waistcoat , black coat , a thin , Jewish beard . In front of that a bare , blond head , the hair rather long — on the front seat , back to the view . [Trust Edith Ethel]421-edith ethel to be accompanied by [a boy]1259-a boy — [poet cicisbeo]3910-poet cicisbeo ! [She]207-sylvia felt pleasure . [She]207-sylvia came off [her]207-sylvia horse like [a circus performer]3918-a circus performer to the sound of “ [Mrs. Tietjens]249-christopher ! Chapter 3

[VALENTINE]449-valentine was awakened by the shrill over - tones of the voice of [the little maid]1139-the little maid coming through the open window . [She]449-valentine had fallen asleep over the words : “ Saepe te in sommnis vidi ! ” to a vision of white limbs in the purple Adriatic . Eventually [the child]1959-the child ’s voice said : “ [We]3942-we only sez ‘ mem ’ to [friends of [the family]894-the family]3943-friends of the family ! ” shrilly and self - assertively . [She]449-valentine was at the casement , dizzy and sickish with the change of position and the haste — and violently impatient of [her]449-valentine condition . Of humanity [she]449-valentine perceived only the top of a three - cornered grey hat and a grey panniered skirt in downward perspective . The sloping tiles of [the potting - shed]3945-the potting - shed hid [the little maid]1139-the little maid ; aligned small lettuce plants , like rosettes on the dark earth , ran from under the window , closed by a wall of sticked peas , behind [them]3936-they the woods , slender grey ash trunks going to a great height . [They]3936-they were needed for shelter . [They]3936-they would have to change [[their]3936-they bedroom]3947-their bedroom : [they]3936-they could not have [a night nursery]3948-a night nursery that faced the north . The spring onions needed pricking out : [she]449-valentine had meant to put [the garden pellitory]3949-the garden pellitory into the rocks in the half - circle ; but the operation had daunted [her]449-valentine . Pushing the little roots into crevices with [her]449-valentine fingers ; removing stones , trowelling in artificial manure , stooping , dirtying [her]449-valentine fingers would make [her]449-valentine retch . . . . [She]449-valentine was suddenly intensely distressed at the thought of the lost coloured prints . [She]449-valentine had searched [the whole house]3950-the whole house — all imaginable drawers , cup - boards , presses . It was like [their]3936-they fate that , when [they]3936-they had at last got a good — [an English — client]3951-an english — client , [their]3936-they first commission from [her]449-valentine should go wrong . [She]449-valentine thought again of every imaginable , unsearched parallelogram in [the house]585-the house , standing erect , [her]449-valentine head up , neglecting to look down on [the intruder]3953-the intruder . [She]449-valentine considered all [[their]3936-they customers]3954-their customers to be [intruders]3955-intruders . It was true that [Christopher]249-christopher ’s gifts lay in the way of old - furniture dealing — and farming . But farming was ruinous . Obviously if [you]3956-you sold old furniture straight out of use in [[your]3956-you own house]3957-your own house , it fetched better prices than from [a shop]3958-a shop . [She]449-valentine did not deny [Christopher]249-christopher ’s ingenuity — or that [he]3959-he was right to rely on [her]449-valentine hardihood . [He]3959-he had at least the right so to rely . Nor did [she]449-valentine mean to let [him]3959-he down . Only . . . [She]449-valentine passionately desired [little Chrissie]425-chrissie to be born in that bed with the thin fine posts , [his]425-chrissie blond head with the thin , fine hair on those pillows . [She]449-valentine passionately desired that [he]425-chrissie should lie with blue eyes gazing at those curtains on the low windows . . . . Those ! With those peacocks and globes . Surely [a child]648-a child should lie gazing at what [[his]648-a child mother]1342-his mother had seen , whilst [she]1342-his mother was awaiting [him]648-a child ! And , where were those prints ? . . . Four parallelograms of faint,‘silly colour . Promised for tomorrow morning . The margins needed bread - crumbing . . . . [She]449-valentine imagined [her]449-valentine chin brushing gently , gently back and forward on the floss of [his]3959-he head ; [she]449-valentine imagined holding [him]3959-he in the air as , in that bed , [she]449-valentine lay , [her]449-valentine arms extended upwards , [her]449-valentine hair spread on those pillows ! Flowers perhaps spread on that quilt . Lavender ! But if [Christopher]249-christopher reported that [one of those dreadful people with querulous voices]3962-one of those dreadful people with querulous voices wanted [a bedroom complete]3963-a bedroom complete ? . . . If [she]449-valentine begged [him]3959-he to retain [it]3963-a bedroom complete for [her]449-valentine . Well , [he]3959-he would . [He]3959-he prized [her]449-valentine above money . [She]449-valentine thought — ah , [she]449-valentine knew — that [he]3959-he prized [the child]1959-the child within [her]449-valentine above [the world]522-the world . Nevertheless , [she]449-valentine imagined that [she]449-valentine would go all on to the end with [her]449-valentine longings unvoiced . . . . Because there was the game . . . . [His]3959-he game . . . oh , hang it , [their]3966-their game ! And [you]3967-you have to think whether it is worse for [the unborn child]504-the unborn child to have [a mother]1955-a mother with unsatisfied longings , or [a father]1957-a father beaten at [his]1957-a father . . . No , [you]3967-you must not call it a game . . . . Still , [roosters beaten by other roosters]3971-roosters beaten by other roosters lose [their]3971-roosters beaten by other roosters masculinity . . . . Like roosters , [men]758-men . . . . On the other hand , for [the mother]1734-the mother the soft feeling that those things give ! . . . [The room]1129-the room had a barrel - shaped ceiling , following the lines of the roof almost up to the roof - tree ; dark oak beams , beeswaxed — ah , that beeswaxing ! Tiny , low windows almost down to the oaken floor . . . . [You]3967-you would say , too much of the show - place : but [you]3967-you lived into [it]3977-it . [You]3967-you lived [yourself]3967-you into [it]3977-it in spite of [the Americans who took , sometimes embarrassed , peeps from the doorway]3978-the americans who took , sometimes embarrassed , peeps from the doorway . What would [He]1957-a father decree ? It was an extraordinary thing to live with [Americans]210-americans all over [you]3967-you , dropping down in aeroplanes , seeming to come up out of [the earth]1429-the earth . . . . There , all of a sudden , [you]3967-you did n’t know how . . . . [That woman below the window]3981-that woman below the window was one , now . [She]3989-that american woman [herself]3989-that american woman was descended from [the surgeon - butler]3992-the surgeon - butler to [Henry VII - Henry the Somethingth]454-henry vii - henry the somethingth . Ah , but [she]3989-that american woman would have ! If there had not been any [HE]3997-he , looking like a great Dutch treckschluyt or whatever [you]3998-you call it — [she]3989-that american woman would have had to invent one to live with in open sin . . . . [The fellow]1767-the fellow never had looked at [her]3989-that american woman . . . cache - corsets . [Marie Léonie]360-marie léonie had . [Marie Léonie]360-marie léonie was of opinion that [she]360-marie léonie would lose [Christopher]249-christopher if [she]360-marie léonie did not deluge [herself]360-marie léonie with a perfume called Houbigant and wear pink silk next the skin . Elle ne demandait pas mieux — but [she]360-marie léonie could not borrow twenty pounds from [Marie Léonie]360-marie léonie . Nor yet forty . . . . [[An Englishman]1414-an englishman ’s house]4097-an englishman ’s house may no longer be [[his]1414-an englishman castle]4098-his castle — but [[an Englishwoman]4099-an englishwoman ’s castle]4100-an englishwoman ’s castle is certainly [[her]4099-an englishwoman own bedroom]4101-her own bedroom . Well , [she]191-valentine had been run down . . . . At that stage of parturition , call it , [a woman]1049-a woman is run down and hysterical . . . . [[Her]191-valentine castle]4106-her castle had been [[her]191-valentine bedroom]4107-her bedroom with a vengeance then — for [Christopher]249-christopher had been unable to get in or [she]191-valentine to get out . [He]425-chrissie had had to whisper through the keyhole that [he]425-chrissie gave in : [he]425-chrissie was dreadfully concerned for [her]191-valentine . [He]425-chrissie had said that [he]425-chrissie hoped [she]191-valentine would try to stick it a little longer , but , if [she]191-valentine would not , [he]425-chrissie would take [Mark]407-mark ’s money . Naturally [she]191-valentine had not let [him]425-chrissie — but [she]191-valentine had arranged with [Marie Léonie]360-marie léonie for [Mark]407-mark to pay a couple of pounds more a week for [their]4108-their board and lodging , and as [Marie Léonie]360-marie léonie had perforce taken over the housekeeping , [they]4108-their had found things easing off a little . [Marie Léonie]360-marie léonie had run [the house]585-the house for thirty shillings a week less than [she]360-marie léonie , [Valentine]191-valentine , had ever been able to do — and run [it]585-the house streets better . The long and complicated annals ‘ . It was queer that [her]191-valentine heart was nearly as much in [Christopher]249-christopher ’s game as was [his]425-chrissie own . As [house - mother]4112-house - mother , [she]191-valentine ought to have grabbed after the last penny — and goodness knew the life was strain enough . Why do [women]759-women back [[their]759-women men]1980-their men in unreasonable romanticisms ? [You]4115-you might say that it was because , if [[their]759-women men]1980-their men had [their]759-women masculinities abated — like [defeated roosters!—the women]4117-defeated roosters!—the women would suffer in intimacies . . . . Ah , but it was n’t that ! Nor was it merely that [they]759-women wanted the buffaloes to which [they]759-women were attached to charge . It was really that [she]191-valentine had followed the convolutions of [[her]191-valentine man]882-her man ’s mind . And ardently approved . [She]191-valentine disapproved with [him]882-her man of riches , of the rich , of the frame of mind that riches confer . If the war had done nothing else for [them]4119-them — for [those two of [them]4119-them]4120-those two of them — it had induced [them]4119-them , at least , to install Frugality as [a deity]746-a deity . [They]4119-them desired to live hard , even if it deprived [them]4119-them of the leisure in which to think high ! [She]191-valentine agreed with [him]882-her man that if [a ruling class]4122-a ruling class loses the capacity to rule — or the desire!—it should abdicate from its privileges and get under - ground . And having accepted that as a principle , [she]191-valentine could follow the rest of [his]882-her man cloudy obsessions and obstinacies . Perhaps [she]191-valentine would not have backed [him]882-her man up in [his]882-her man long struggle with [dear Mark]407-mark if [she]191-valentine had not considered that [their]4119-them main necessity was to live high . . . . And [she]191-valentine was aware that why , really , [she]191-valentine had sprung to the door rather than to the window had been that [she]191-valentine had not desired to make an unfair move in that long chess game . On behalf of [Christopher]249-christopher . [MARK TIETJENS]199-mark had lain considering the satisfaction of a great night [he]199-mark had lately passed . Or perhaps not lately : at some time . Lying out there in the black nights , the sky seemed enormous . [You]4319-you could understand how [somewhere heaven]4320-somewhere heaven could be concealed in [it]4321-it . And tranquil at times . Then [you]4319-you felt [the earth]1429-the earth wheeling through infinity . Night birds cried overhead : herons , duck , swans even : the owls kept closer to the ground , beating along the hedgegrows . [Beasts]475-beasts became busy in the long grass . [They]475-beasts rustled busily ; then paused for long . No doubt a rabbit ran till [it]4323-it found an attractive plantain . Then it nibbled for a long time without audible movement . Now and then cattle lowed , or many lambs — frightened by a fox maybe . . . . But there would be nevertheless long silences . . . . [A stoat]4324-a stoat would get onto the track of the rabbit . [They]4313-they would run , run , run brushing through the long grass , then out into [the short meadow]4325-the short meadow and round and round , the rabbit squealing . Loudly at first . In the dim illumination of [his]199-mark night - light , dormice would climb up the posts of [[his]199-mark shelter]612-his shelter . [They]4313-they would remain regarding [him]199-mark with beads of eyes . When the rabbits squealed [they]4313-they would hunch [themselves]4313-they together and shiver . [They]4313-they knew it meant S - t - o - a - t = stoat ! [Their]4313-they turn soon ! [He]199-mark despised [himself]199-mark a little for attending to these minutiae — as if [one]491-one were talking down to [a child]648-a child . . . . On [his]199-mark great night the whole cattle of [the county]4329-the county had been struck with panic ; [you]4330-you heard [them]4313-they crashing down through the hedges and miles down into [the silent valleys]4331-the silent valleys . No ! [He]199-mark had never been one to waste [his]199-mark time and mind on small mammals and small birds . . . . The Flora and Fauna of [Blankshire]175-blankshire ! . . . Not for [him]199-mark . It was big movements interested [him]199-mark : “ wherein manifesteth itself the voice of [God]257-god ! ” . . . Very likely that was true . Transport . Panic in cattle over [whole counties]4332-whole counties . In [people]1333-people over [whole continents]4334-whole continents . Once , years — oh , years and years — ago , when [he]199-mark had been aged twelve and on a visit to [Grandfather]476-grandfather , [he]199-mark had taken a gun to [[Redcar]76-redcar sands from [Groby]217-groby , over [the moors]1652-the moors]4335-redcar sands from groby , over the moors , and with one shot [he]199-mark had brought down two terns , [a sandpiper]4337-a sandpiper and a herring gull . [Grandfather]476-grandfather had been so delighted with [his]199-mark prowess — though naturally the shot had been a fluke — that [he]476-grandfather had the things stuffed , and there they were in [Groby Nursery]176-groby nursery to this day . The herring gull stiff on [a mossy rock]4338-a mossy rock ; [the sandpiper]4339-the sandpiper doing obeisance before it , the terns flying , one on each side . Probably that was the only memorial to [him]476-grandfather , [Mark Tietjens]199-mark , at [Groby]217-groby . [The younger children]4340-the younger children had been wo nt to refer with awe to “ [Mark]199-mark ’s bag ” for long years afterwards . The painted background had shewn [Bamborough Castle]177-bamborough castle with lashings of foam and blue sky . It was a far cry from [Redcar]76-redcar to [Bamborough]178-bamborough — but that was the only background the bird - stuffing chap in [Middlesbrough]179-middlesbrough could paint for sea - birds . For larks and the like [he]199-mark had [a cornfield in [the Vale of [York]147-york]4342-the vale of york]4341-a cornfield in the vale of york ; for nightingales , poplar trees . . . . Never heard that [nightingales]4343-nightingales were particularly partial to poplars ! . . . [Nightingales]4343-nightingales disturbed the majesty of great nights . For two months out of the year , more or less , according to the nature of the season . [He]199-mark was n’t decrying the beauty of [their]4343-nightingales voices . Hearing [them]4343-nightingales [you]4345-you felt like seeing a good horse win the St. Leger . No other things in [the world]522-the world could do it justice — there was no place in [the world]522-the world like [Newmarket Heath]180-newmarket heath on a breezy day . . . . But [they]4343-nightingales limited the night . It was true that nightingales deep down in the spinney near where [[Gunning]198-gunning ’s hut]4348-gunning ’s hut must be — say a quarter of a mile away — could make [you]4345-you think of great distance , echoing up through [the deep woods]4349-the deep woods . Woods dripping with dew beneath the moon . . . . And air - raids not so long ago ! The moon brought air - raids and its shining was discouraged . . . . Yes , [nightingales]4343-nightingales made [you]4345-you think of distance , just as the night - jar for ever crepitating from twilight to dawn seemed to measure a fragment of eternity . . . . But only fragments ! The great night was itself eternity and the In - finite . . . . The spirit of [God]257-god walking on the firmament . . . . Ah . . . . It came to [his]198-gunning mind to remember , almost with pain . [He]198-gunning had accepted [nephew Mark]199-mark as [nephew Mark]4407-nephew mark : [a strong slip]4408-a strong slip . [A good boy]4409-a good boy . But there was the point . . . the point ! . . . [The boy]1269-the boy had the right sort of breeches . . . . But if there were incest . . . . Crawling through a hedge after a rabbit was thinkable . [Father]300-father had been in [the churchyard]4411-the churchyard to shoot rabbits to oblige [the vicar]4412-the vicar . There was no doubt of that . [He]300-father did not want rabbits . . . . But supposing [he]300-father had mishit a bunny and [the little beast]4413-the little beast had been throwing gymnastics on the other side of the quickset ? [Father]300-father would have crawled through then , rather than go all the way to [the lychgate]4414-the lychgate and round . [Decent men]4415-decent men put [their]4415-decent men mishits out of [their]4415-decent men agony as soon as possible . Then there was motive . And as for not putting [his]198-gunning gun out of action before crawling through the quickset . . . . [Many good , plucked men]4416-many good , plucked men had died like that . . . . And [father]1431-father had grown absent - minded . ’ . . . There had been [farmer Lowther]193-mrs. lowther had so died ; and [Pease of Lobhall]479-pease of lobhall ; and [Pease of Cullercoats]480-pease of cullercoats .
